I thanked him for caring about quality and training with great staff and he thanked me with another Irish Coffee on the house. I cant say enough about the staff here.c
      Let's go back to MY FAVORITE MEAL OF THE WEEK (check my reviews to see what this meal beat out). The corned beef hash had a very simple description: Housemade Corned beef Hash: poached eggs, Hollandaise. Let me tell you there was nothing simple about this dish. Lets work from the ground up. The hash was a pile of juicy shredded corned beef with grilled potato pieces throughout. The star of the hash was definitely the corned beef with just enough potato to make it hash. The two poached eggs were poached very precise; we take for granted sometimes how rare it is to get a perfectly poached egg. The Hollandaise sauce was deliciously delicate with a texture to die for and a flavor to raise you back to life. I ate this meal as slow as I could because I did not want to eat the last bite.
      I had such a great meal I felt guilty that my wife wasn't with me. I ordered a Poutine to go for her, heated it up for lunch a few days later and decided we need to go back to Chicago next weekend for brunch. Thank You Gage Hospitality group for caring about your customers and your quality. You have a customer for life.

When on Michigan avenue in the loop considering eating options, you will inevitably receive this recommendation. "Go to The Gage man!" I have one good friend that is a self confessed gastro-pub-a-holic; and whenever we dine out, usually he has some over priced gastro pub picked out for us to try. Some are good, some not so. I would have to put The Gage in the later category based on my experience. My take aways:
1) Prime time is crazy busy, with helacious wait times for seating, and mob crowds
2) Bar area is packed and has limited accessibility
3) The two bartenders I encountered, the red head was pleasant, the brunette, not so much. In fact, for a bar tender, extremely difficult to catch her eye.
4) Had to ask for the booze menu that is kept behind the bar
5) Saw the most Whistle Pig poured out evah, and I'm pretty sure that is an $18 drink, the bar tender was pouring it from the well it was that frequent
6) Everyone is making due at the bar, so be prepared to get cozy with your neighbors
7)  I actually like the downstairs bathrooms here, perhaps a welcome relief from the mobs up top
8) The person next to me ordered the mussels and they looked and smelled good
9) My cohort ordered the fish and chips and was very underwhelmed
10) I ordered the venison poutine, sounded like it was full of potential. Boy was I disappointed to receive a bowl of mushy fries with toppings. Isn't the trick to poutine to have the fries be more nacho like, just crispy enough?
11) You can't choose your bar mates but boy there was one group of guys that were just totally housing, gang busters loud, and showing no signs of leaving anytime soon, and I was there for a good chunk of time.

Would the experience be different if I was seated at a table and ordered high end of the menu? IDK, you tell me, but I'm not sure I really wish to find out.

Been here a few tikes and never been disappointed. Has cute outdoor seating perfect for after work drinks staff is friendly. Had the lamb with spaetzle, medium rare and it was very good. Thai coconut curry with scallops was very good as well.

Decent place for an upscale American meal and right next to Millennium Park. The server was very nice and the decor had a cool speak-easy feel. It was a bit loud walking through the front/bar area, but sitting in the back was quiet and private.
I got the Roasted Lamb Loins and they were great! There was a small salad on top, which was alright, the brussel sprouts were too raw for my liking. The lamb itself was medium doneness, pretty good. But my favorite part was the spatzle, a German egg noodle. It was soft and doughy in the right way and tasted amazing. I'd also highly recommend the mint chocolate coupe too! Overall a good meal, albeit it a little pricey.

I'm so happy that I got to check out the Gage. I've walked past it so many times while downtown.

Most people will only want to sit on the patio, because when it's beautiful outside you don't want to waste a single second of it by being inside. The inside of the restaurant is much larger then I expected. The decor is very upscale. The clientele was a nice mix of families and people that were a little older. I suppose that's expected on mother's day.

The food was absolutely delicious but it became very limited for me personally, due to my shellfish allergy. I was informed by my waiter and the restaurant manager that they wouldn't recommend that I try anything that is fried due to the possibly of cross contamination. I was bummed because a lot of the fried dishes were marked as having a high ranking with past customers.

Even though I was bummed, the restaurant manager was extremely helpful and accommodating to my allergy. They were able to make one of the appetizers that someone at my table as raving about without flash frying it. I was appreciative of the gesture! It's always nice when a place takes an extra minute to walk you through your opinion and work to try to substitute how it's cooked for you to enjoy the dish.

I would highly recommend checking them out!

The Gage dining gives you a very classic Chicago experience. Our evening began with ordering overly iced seasonal cocktail "Livin Easy". The appetizer "Scotch Egg" is a must try. Very crispy and delicious with a dash of dijon mustard. Fish And chips was good although I've had better fries. Thai Coconut curry is very tropical and flavorful. If you wanna end your evening on a high note then take a shot or two of "Lemon Drops".

pics.caption: Scotch Egg, Today 's Fish & Chips and When the Livin's Easy

review.des:
YUP!  

The poutine is just right.  SO many people screw up poutine and The Gage nailed it.

The Fish & Chips were perfect and authentic.

The Chiliquiles with house made chorizo were perfect.

The Venison Burger was served at a perfect medium rare and was one of the better burgers I have had in my whole life.

The beer selection of local craft brews met every taste.

The service was about as good as it gets.

I highly suggest stopping by the Gage.

Best iceberg salad I have ever had. Added a venison patty to it which was great. PIlsner beer was solid.
GF ordered lobster roll. She enjoyed it but said it was only 3.5 stars (portion size and taste). Ordered the truffle fries. That's why I give this joint a 4. They were just regular fries and hence overpriced.

Located in short walking distance between Millennium Park and Art Institute of Chicago. Perfect place to go for lunch, serving American breakfast and brunch, including a wide selection of wine.

Place looked busy on the outside even at around 3pm. Fortunately, we got seated right away.

We got the Corn Beef Hash that came with two poached eggs on top and cold slaw on the side ($14). We also got the Fish and Chips that came with three large pieces and a good handful of fries ($19). We also got a side of Zucchini Bread that came with warm cinnamon butter on the side ($8). We wanted to order desert but were too full by the end.

Everything we got were delicious. Flavors were spot on. Not too salty, sweet or overwhelming. The Fish and Chips were our favorite because they were nicely battered and crisp on the outside and super warm and soft on the inside. We ate everything on our plates, including the left over crumbs.

Excellent service. Excellent meal. Excellent spot to try, if you haven't already.

The Gage is a beautiful, special space that used to be a hat factory. It's in a very touristy part of town, but don't let that stop you from coming here.

We've been here twice for brunch and both times it was excellent.

The two biggest hits on the brunch menu are the CORNED BEEF HASH and the VENISON BURGER. if you've ever had corned beef hash and thought "this is kinda good," then you should come for brunch on Saturday or Sunday and try Gage's homemade version. It will blow your mind. I can't imagine that corned beef hash gets any better than this.

Ditto for the venison burger. My husband and I both think it's probably the best burger we've ever had. I can't think of one better. It was moist and juicy, even though we ordered it medium well, which is pretty incredible.

The SCOTCH EGG is a fun treat, and if you aren't sure you will like it keep in mind they are sold individually, so you won't be staring down 6 scotch eggs thinking how can I eat these monstrosities. You'll only get one unless you ask for more.

A couple with excellent taste in food told us we had to come here for the POUTINE, which was good but not something we would order again. Apparently poutine can only get so good. It was like eating a thick stew with gravy and cheese curds and a few carrots. It is definitely the best poutine I've ever had, but the other items on the menu outshine it.

We also had the ZUCCHINI BREAD special, which was similarly excellent, and very sweet, served with sweet cinnamon butter.

Seriously you can't go wrong here. They know what they're doing.

I went to The Gage for dinner and left satisfied. The service here is spectacular and speedy. Upon entering, I was immediately greeted and seated. My waiter came by within 5 minutes to take my order. He was extremely knowledgeable of the menu and recommended the Roasted Elk Rack, which is what I ended up getting.

The elk was fairly good. The gamey venison paired well with the sauce. My only complaint was that the waiter said the elk would be medium, but it came out as rare.

I really enjoyed my visit to the Gage! Their staff is very attentive and efficient and the restaurant had the bustling ambiance that accompanies lunchtime on a weekday in Chicago. The food was presented very well and tasted very fresh. I recommend walking off your meal at the Art Institute down the street.
We booked a table for ten of us for a business team dinner.  Service was good, appetizers were great and all the meals were delicious.  A definite to do for your dining list.

I just had a really nice business lunch here and was very impressed. We had sub-style sandwiches, coffee, teas, and desserts for our party of 10.

I like the private dining area downstairs below the bar. It was quiet - something needed because upstairs is fairly loud.

Friendly, attentive staff. Impressed.

Fantastic food here! The sweet potato puree soup is poured over some chopped sausages and creme. It is delicious. The brussel sprouts are also great, and not overcooked! I got the Amish Chicken, tender breast accompanied by sauteed vegetables in a somewhat tangy sauce. A guaranteed classy meal in a classy restaurant.

Went here for Valentine's Day two years in a row.  My husband forgot what he had last year and thought it must have been a forgettable experience.  I convinced him to try it again, and am so happy I did!  Their gin and tonic might be the best I've had-- it's unique but very fresh.  We got the vegetable mezzo appetizer, which had the best baba ganoush I think I've ever had. For entrees, I got the vegetarian curry-- it's super flavorful and creamy, without being too rich.  My husband got the osso bucco which he said was so good that he kept trying to scrape out more marrow.  For dessert, we shared the lemon bar and enjoyed every single bite.  The service was great.  I wish we had gotten the name of our waiter, as he recommended both the osso bucco and lemon bar, but he was fantastic and attentive.  We will definitely be back.

pics.caption: Roasted Fall Vegetable Mezze was so good!
Thai Coconut Curry-- a really flavorful vegetarian option

review.des:
A m b i a n c e:
Dressy, steakhouse vibe, date night feels

N o i s e  L e v e l:
Medium levels, went on a busy night and it was easy to talk

D r i n k s:
Wine pours are on point! Definitely a great value, didn't have a chance to try cocktails, but they looked well made.

F o o d:
Sampled fries, a Mediterranean platter with veggies, cheese board, Brussels sprouts, all very tasty.

R e v i s i t:
YES, want to come back to try other menu items and cocktails.

The location of this place is fantastic, but that's about it. The food is decent and very overpriced . There are better restaurants can be found down Michigan Avenue and near by, wouldn't waste my time coming here again.
The poutine fries were amazing. We split the fried pickles and house poutine for lunch and it was just enough food for two of us. Highly recommend.

Service was good. Little limited on selection.   Had a club sandwich which was...ok...I was ready to jump on the counter for a bit more meat in my sandwich however.  I was shedding a bit so we did not try the desert...dang master...

It was our first time at The Gage and was recommended by the staff at the Langham Hotel. I had the venison burger medium rare and it was excellent. I thought it might taste gamey, but it didn't. We ate there on a Friday night and the crowd noise was fairly high. The service was very good. We thought about going back a second time while we were still in town.

pics.caption: Grilled Venison Burger. Very lean and flavorful. Not gamey.

review.des: On the roadtrip from Boston to Chicago, this is by far the number 1 restaurant in our opinion. Amazing service by Paul, great food and wonderful cocktails! Mussels is for sure to die for. Bluefin and lamp makes you feel like you are in heaven. Finished the experience with strawberry chesscake, dark chocolate mousse. I am usually not a crazy dessert person, but the dessert is a must have! Can't believe how amazing the test is all together. If you never been here, must try! Just saying.....

We celebrated Valentine's Day at The Gage and it was great. I order the halibut which was ok, not one of the best that I ever tried. We also order one of the multiple choices of stake that turned up being very good cooked. Mash potatoes was to die for, mmmhhmmmm the best ever!!!! (See photo)
Also I will give some credit to our server who was great and super funny.

The service was quick and efficient. They knew we had a 1930 show to catch at the CIBC theater for Hamilton. We had approximately 30mins to eat. They got us in and out and it was great.

The gin fizz was not heavy handed but just right. Not the best I've ever had but definitely one of the better ones.

I am just not convinced that the food was good enough to justify the price point. Easily ~$200/pp with drinks. The green beans were a bit too salty and nothing special. The filet wad a bit too charred, leaning towards the side of burnt. I don't mind paying $$$ for exquisite dining experiences. This was just not one of those.

Great place for after-work drinks and dinner!

Pros:

(1) location: conveniently and centrally located
(2) Scotch Eggs--must try appetizer
(3) reasonably priced drinks for Chicago
(4) the Thai curry with scallops was absolutely delicious. The scallops (albeit, you only get two) were some of the largest I have seen

Neutral:

(1) somewhat of a wait around 7pm; I would recommend making reservation in advance

Cons:

None

This is a cute hotspot for brunchers! There was a constant steady flow of hungry brunchers. It was the boyfriend and my first time and I think we would visit again. Th menu has a good selection, prices weren't bad considering the location across from the Bean. We started off with the cheese filled biscuits topped with honey glaze and side of goat butter. I then had a lobster roll with chorizo aioli. The BF had the steak and eggs Benedict. The steak was a bit charred on the side even though he asked for medium rare. Overall it was a nice experience. For those who don't like close seatings... may not be the place for you because you can hear your neighbors conversations...We didn't mind. The bathroom is downstairs where there is a bar area. Really cute and quaint. It wasn't open at the time but I think during happy hour or late night it would be hopping.

Decided to try since it was close to my hotel and had pretty good reviews. I wasn't over the moon about it but certainly good food for a quick bite. Had their tomato soup, plum and peach salad, "ton" of vegetables (which was wonderfully prepared). Happy with the service as well.

Ate here on a beautiful Sunday afternoon for lunch (they have a brunch menu with plenty of breakfasty and lunchy options). Our table had the scallops, the crispy chicken sandwich, the fish & chips and hamburger. All were excellent. The scallop dish is really a salad of julienned beets and veggies, with three beautifully seared scallops -- the flavors were outstanding. The service here was also perfect.

I really like how not only their bar is open seating, but the small circular tables for 2 right behind the bars are as well. Open seating and no wait ftw!

Mushroom sandwich (3.5/5) - Not bad. The bread could be a lot softer. I really don't like biting into a hard sandwich. I really got a lot of that mushroom flavor. A decent sandwich, but nothing amazing about it.

Venison burger (4/5) - I like the unique flavors they go for here, especially with the fried jalapeno. I normally don't like jalapeno, but frying it reduces the strong and sharp heat you get from jalapenos, but keeps the flavor. A nice and unique dish

The location of this place is so convenient. Right next to millennium park where you can check out cloud/gate aka the infamous bean!

Nice dinner option on Michigan Ave. The staff is very professional and made our dining experience truly memorable. Even the Chicago weather cooperated and we dined outside.  Fish & Chips were great, burger could have been seasoned a little more, maybe offer salt & pepper on tables.  Thoroughly enjoyed the specialty cocktail, the Gilded Hour and topped it off with the Sweet Corn Sunday.

Fish and chips, you'll lick your lips.

While visiting Chicago this past weekend, we made a great lunch choice by dropping by The Gage on S Michigan, not far from where we were staying. It's a beautiful spot, great looking bar, and they have what looks like a party room downstairs.

Now, before you read on, and your mouth starts watering, be aware - this place fills up fast. We got there at 11:45am and patio seating was already full. Inside was pretty empty, but by 12:15, all full. And that was on a Monday. So, if you really want to eat here, arrive early, or make a reservation.

Our server was Janelle, and she was great - very pleasant and helpful - terrific service, thank you!

So naturally I had the fish and chips (see my other review of the Pittsfield Cafe to see why I needed this win). And it was outstanding. Small morsels of fish filled the newsprint cup, and they were "lick your lips" yummy. Soft inside, crunchy outside, just perfect. Fries were good also, but clearly not the main event. And, good size portions.

My wife had the burger (yes, there was a bit of a theme on this trip). And it was outstanding as well. Cooked to perfection, brimming with goat cheese and jalapenos, there was no problem polishing it off.

Great lunch - a perfect way to finish off our eating tour of Chicago. We'll be back, just not soon enough!

pics.caption: Lick your lips - have the fish & chips

review.des: Came here for a business meeting. I had the chicken and orzo soup but it was kind of bland. As well as the spicy fried chicken, had some spice to it but again pretty bland. It wasn't crunchy like fried chicken, which threw me off. The decor is pretty cool in there, they have a pretty good beer selection as well!

Before anything, I must mention Azrhiel Frost, some sort of manager there. She was engaging and suggested the river architecture tour for us out-of-towners, along with other things. She was so nice and so welcoming to us to Chicago! Loved her.
Ok, now to the food.... OFF THE HOOK! We went simple with fried pickles; crispy, bright, divine sauce as our appetizer. Split the Lobster Roll as our main. So delicious! Wanted the whole thing to myself but realistically, it's richness, half was just right for lunch.
Love this place! Love the Dearborn more! Food is consistently good and the menu changes feel fresh.  A downtown staple.

Everything we had was wonderful except the pork poutine, that was gloppy and a little gross honestly. Service and atmosphere were fantastic, will definitely hit this place again when we get back to Chicago! :D
Great food! Thai curry was nice and fulfilling! Wes was very attentive and informative about the surrounding area! Would recommend!
pretty decently cooked venison burger with smoked gouda, fried jalapeno, woodland mushrooms. good cheese slightly salty, split the pear salad too

Here's the breakdown, to be brief, because I could go on for a while:

Mike D. was the man, he went above and beyond and was so knowledgeable about everything that The Gage had to offer.  

The food was exquisite and the staff have so much integrity to the company, you can tell that they take pride for their place of work.  

The manager (forgive me I forgot your name!), went over the top to give us a desert on the house for thanking THEM for such an awesome experience, which tasted incredible...

...to The Gage and Mike D., thank you for making our dining experience in Chicago top notch!

Not sure why they got the 4 star rating except for the lack of competition in the area. The service was good and so was the drink and the ambience is decent but the burger wasn't as good as I'd hoped. It tasted pretty bland and seemed like a frozen patty. The fries were plain and lackluster too.

We kind of happened on this place, expecting it to be good. We had no idea just how good it would be.

She had the flounder, which was melt-in-your-mouth delicious. Cooked perfectly with a phenomenal crust. I had the lamb, medium rare. The ends we're a bit off but still tasty. The center was perfect. The pesto spaetzle and Brussels sprouts were also divine.

Dessert was... well, let's just say that we came back the following night and ordered two. The mousse and the "brownie" were incredible.

This place is simply exquisite!!! Customer service, food and over all ambiance is 100! I would recommend this place any day of the week. Filet mignon melts in your mouth, asparagus with crispy kapers are savory and the creme brûlée is the perfect ending! 5 stars to a great establishment!

Came here for lunch before going to the Art Institute. Since it was late afternoon we were seated quickly. The service and atmosphere are both very nice. The reason for my middle of the road ranking is the food. I had the hamburger and soup. While both were good, they were both overly salty. So salty that I'm still thirsty and feel swollen today (next day). I would say of you do eat here just ask them to go easy on the sodium.

Went to the Gage this past weekend after a day of museum hopping.  The service, food, wine, beer and scotch selection were all outstanding.  We had the fish and chips and the octoberfest schnitzel.  Both were tasty and prepared to perfection.

Will definitely be returning to the Gage.

Followed Yelpers advice and got the venison burger... it was outstanding. Also the soup and poutin were very good. Service was great. I sat in the bar before eating, and there are some great beers.. I recommend the rocky road & apex predator. I would definitely return.
I had the black bean burger it was amazing and so filling. The best part was the cheese biscuit with honey that was the highlight of the meal

I was blown away by the service here! From the hostesses to waiters to the manager. The manager greeted us and had a quick chat about our newborn and upon leaving he even remembered our baby's name! ..and again remembered our little one when we returned the following day! I've come for brunch, lunch, and dinner and enjoyed the menus at each. My favorite item is the Alaska Halibut which is cooked to perfection with the perfect amount of sauce and veggies to complement. From the lunch menu, the homemade black bean burger was the best veggie burger I have had - juicy, flavorful, and so fresh! The Thai curry is different than your standard curry - creamier than regular curry but tasted fresher. My favorite dessert is the chocolate brownie crunch bar! If you get the carrot cake I recommend asking go have it warmed up - otherwise it comes cold straight from the fridge. The dark chocolate moose is nothing special.

Cute patio with string lights overlooking millennium park.

We popped in here for a drink and appetizer bc it was close to our hotel.. ended up going back 2 more times. We were able to sit at the bar each time.. Jose was our bartender and provided excellent service each time. Great atmosphere. The mussels and the fish and chips were very good. The fish was fried perfect. Great beer list. Prices are very reasonable.
Meh not that great. I got the venison burger and it was just ok. The drinks and service were great, but I would not recommend their burgers.

We were here a few years ago for St. Patrick's Day and had such a great time enjoying the bag pipes and eating the delicious Irish food, we decided to come back.  Just got here but so far so good!!

The bagpiper was the same they had when we were here in 2013.  He's incredible!! To top it off they have an Irish band and the same delicious food.  It was the best corn beef and fish and chips ever!

This is an upscale American eatery with food that is good but overpriced. The poutine was excellent - a nice balance of gravy and cheese and potatoes. I had a green salad with chicken. The salad size was much smaller than what I expected for a $12 or so salad with another $8 for the chicken. The presentation was nice and the chicken arrived bone in, but it was dry which is disappointing for the price range. My husband had the fish and chips. The portions of each were big but he said it was "regular ole fish n chips." I had the apple tatin for dessert. It was large and tasty but didn't have enough cinnamon and, again, was overpriced. In total we spent $125 for the meal which included half of the poutine (we were with friends), the 2 entrees, a pour of whiskey, and a dessert. The place is huge but has cozy spots to eat. The service was very good. It looks like it gets a mix of casual and fancy attire. Good place, but for the $$ I was expecting something a little more mind-blowing.
Yum.  I had the scallops, the hubby had the New York strip.  It was excellently cooked with lots of flavor.  I highly recommend.

This is an solid spot tucked away on Michigan Avenue but totally worth checking out if you're looking for a classic bar to grab a drink after work. They have a typical menu selection and the drinks are great.

The service was good. Nothing to write home about. I'd consider returning if I were grabbing a drink in the area and would recommend to others. I'm not rushing back here but not opposed to future visits.

This place is amazing.  Wonderful decor, great atmosphere & fantastic food.  The service was great. I had my 1st try with poutine and let me tell you it was freeking awesome.  Had the house poutine.  Then I had a venison burger.  Mmmm, so good.  Downstairs there is a private room that gives it a speakeasy feeling.  This place know what they are doing!!  Keep it up!!!

This is a magical place. I can't express how good the service and the food was. We ordered the 60-day aged sirloin with eggs special and their regular burger. Both were beyond amazing. The sirloin was perfect with great aroma, the potatoes were rich and flavorfull. The orange mimosas were also amazing. Next we got the chocolate bar crunch thing, it has a crunchy bottom layer, dark chocolate then softer bronwish chocolate layer topped with crunchy vanilla. This was also phenomonenal! The waiter was super professional and knowledgable! 100%!!!

pics.caption: The regular burger and 60-day aged sirloin with eggs for brunch

review.des:
The Gage was a cool gastropub to visit. The waitress recommend a wine that was good and had suggestions for the menu.

I order mussels which were flavorful and a generous portion and Brussels sprouts that could have been cooked and seasoned more. My friend order some sort of spicy rib and fries, the ribs were good.

Good food and service but it didn't stand out to me as somewhere I'd visit again if I were ever in Chicago. Tasted like good solid food I can get in Annapolis or D.C.  

Location was good and the food I did have was above average so overall a sold 3.5 or 4.

Recently went here for an afternoon lunch with my mom! Nice server and very accommodating hosts. We initially asked to sit outside, but then the sun left within 10 minutes and it got waaay too cold. So, we went back inside to ask for a different table. Very nice about the whole thing!

Ordered When The Livin's Easy and Over The Moon for drinks. Both very refreshing, but WTLE was very unique (strong basil flavor) and overall a better choice.

Ordered Cheddar Biscuits as an appetizer. Tasty, but not amazing. Easily shareable between 3-4 people!

I ordered the Spicy Chicken Sandwich and my mom ordered the Spring Asparagus Salad with Prawns. Sandwich was pretty tasty and came with homemade chips (I think). But, the flavors are very much "buffalo" sauce than like a chipotle so it threw me off a bit. Mom's salad was delicious though.

Espresso and honeycomb ice cream for dessert! Mom liked her espresso, pretty normal run-of-the-mill coffee drink. Ice cream was extremely sweet, so if you have a sweet tooth, you'll like it.

Good bread, decent chips (fries), the batter for fish really needs seasoning. Luckly I got it for takeout so I poured malt vinegar on it to give it real taste. Cant says I'll return or recommend it for food but maybe for drinking. The place seems upscale and lively so that's good to know.

Wonderful place with great food and super friendly staff.  The decor is very nice and the food delectable.  Definitely get the cheese platter for an appetizer and their "Wake me up" cold brew cocktail was awesome!

Really good ! Succulent ! Highly recommended
Try the crab and avocado dish and the bison tartar !

We had a great time!! The Gage was recommended to us by a police officer after we visited Cloud Gate. The atmosphere was fun, but classy. The attire of all the staff was trendy and sharp. The food was amazing! There were two of us and we shared two of the share plates. We started with rock crab and avocado toast and the poutine. Our waiter assured us we wouldn't need an entree, and he was right! The portions of the share plates were generous. We ended our dine with two desserts....phenomenal! Trenton recommended the summer strawberry cheesecake and he was on point. Amazing. We also had the chocolate brownie toffee thing...so rich, so great. I'd recommend this to anyone visiting Chicago! Finally- major shout out to Trent! Great service, great smile, very personable!
Good food. Great service. Quaint and inviting space. Would recommend without a doubt.

What an amazing place. We were in town for a conference, and asked a friend where to dine at. Immediately he said The Gage. Our late lunch was simply perfect. We tried the half sandwich and cup of soup with some of the best fried pickles I've ever had. The meal was much larger than expected! If I return to Chicago I definitely need to return for more!

Is your shirt tucked in? Are your nails manicured? Do you have a transatlantic accent? Then you may enter The Gage.

Don't get me wrong, The Gage doesn't seem like the kind of place to deny people entry based on a patron's "matching colors of the shoes, hat, and/or shirt" (*cough*bottled blonde*cough*) but I didn't get the feeling that I could stop in after a good workout at the gym to have a drink. Really, no one should feel so comfortable with most establishments. Get your stuff together, everyone!

Meanwhile, my companion and I stopped by on a Thursday night. The place was pretty full and lively. Everyone genuinely seemed to be having a good time. We got a two-top across from the bar. I had a bit of difficulty hearing my friend across that teeny table, but it is a bar, so it was nothing new. We enjoyed non-cocktail beverages so I can't comment on the skill of the bartenders nor the chef as we didn't eat. The waitress was great (albeit exposing so much cleavage I thought to question the tipping situation). The ladies room was well cared for, but in a labyrinth.

Seems like a cool place for a fancy-ish happy hour (IDK about the specials). I'd consider returning with out-of-towners I want to impress.

So, many of my friends from all over recommended The Gage to me during my stay in Chicago.  I waited to go until my last meal.  That was a mistake.  See, now I'm spoiled for it and find myself wishing I had gone my first day so I could have enjoyed it at least a time or two again.  

The service was friendly, very efficient, and genuine.  

The food was...kinda perfect.  Smoked duck poutine as a starter and the lobster roll.  The only thing that would have improved my visit is a side of Lipitor to offset my likely wide cholesterol swing.  Oh well.  It was still worth it 100 times over.

Beautiful bar and interior and friendly host! My friend and I had dinner reservations and got a drink at the bar before we were seated. The bartenders weren't very attentive but whatever. We got seated right after we got drinks. Our server was friendly. There was a stunningly handsome silver fox, dressed in a gray suit looking so dapper, I don't know if he is the manager but he was going around checking on the guests and seemed like he helped the servers out too. Overall great atmosphere. We ordered the mussels..amazing! The broth was delicious! The fried pickles were great also. We ordered calamari but expected it to be fried. It wasn't. It was warm, not hot, and just not what we expected. The wedge salad was great! So simple but the dressing was so good! Go here!

A vegan, a vegetarian, and a meat lover go walking into a restaurant....the vegan says I hope I can find something to eat here and she does. A delicious bean burger that had a hint of spiciness to it with a side of greens. The vegetarian wonders what she will eat and there are plenty of options. She chooses the fish and chips which is served with a side of homemade tarter sauce and a side of vinegar yum! The meat lover says I can order everything on the menu and chooses a phenomenal venison burger with wild mushrooms, smoked Gouda and jalapeños on it which both the vegan and vegetarian snuck a bite of. Yummm! The end!

Centrally located in Chicago, close to Grant Park and near the hotel-populated River North, I was pleasantly blown away by The Gage. It has a lively atmosphere and nice bar. The bartender was professional, friendly and knew the food well. The menu has lots of great items, making choosing difficult. A tomato and kale salad with burrata was one of the best tomato dishes that I've ever had (and I've had a lot!). A special of striped sea bass over a unique purple pesto was also quite a pleaser. There's a great wine list as well (and I enjoyed half off on bottles that is available at certain times certain nights. This restaurant will definitely remain high on my list when visiting Chicago.

pics.caption: Striped Sea Bass over purple pesto with broccolini.
Tomato and kale salad with burrata, aged balsamic and country bread.
Margerum M5 Red Blend from Santa Barbara [44% Grenache, 36% Syrah]

review.des: Had dinner here with a few good friends. We were seated right away, the hostess was courteous and gave us options where to sit. Since it was mild weather we chose the patio. The service was very prompt, our waiter was very engaging and professional, you don't see that at many establishments. My friends had some wine and I chose just sparkling water. I had the special of the house, sea bass. It was perfectly prepared. We really had a great experience. Coming from Orange County, CA that standards of this place was excellent. I highly recommend them.

Went here for restaurant week on 7:30pm on a Wednesday. The ambience is cozy - dim but not awfully dark like other places attempting an intimate vibe. Scene was bustling with suits.

We all started off with a glass of Pinot Noir from Sonoma ($15) which was 2 glasses worth per person. Wine was really good. I opted out of the restaurant week menu, but my two friends both got the Griddled Bucheron Cheese (quince & sprouted grain salad, poached quince, winter spice vinaigrette), grilled albacore tuna (plantain, fennel, cured tomato, fried lemon, mojo rojo sauce), and chocolate truffle cake (chocolate crunch, sponge cake, truffles, caramel). The Griddled Bucheron Cheese was very tasty and paired deliciously with the Pinot. I tried the tuna - generous portions, grilled nicely, interesting flavor profiles with the plantain and chipotle style sauce. We had the Brussels sprouts and charred green beans to share. I'd say pass on green beans but Brussels sprouts were tasty and pretty rich for a veggie dish. Wish I tried the roast turnips/radishes.

I had the bouillabaisse (roasted monkfish, clams, shrimp, fennel, rouille) which was a very filling portion. The broth could've been more flavorful. For dessert, I had the Honeycrisp Apple Crumble (calvados jam, oat streusel, apple cider frozen yogurt). It came in a warm skillet bowl and was AMAZING. I'm not a dessert person, but that was my  favorite dish of the night, followed by the Griddled Bucheron Cheese.

Everything looked and sounded so good that I couldn't decide what to get. I finally chose the venison burger with fresh cut fries and honestly to say I liked it! Service was great, everyone was friendly, and the patio was very comfortable. I'll definitely be back next time I'm in town!

Classy, sophisticated yet very real with a wonderful Irish oriented cuisine and fabulous beer selection. Service is professional, attentive and accommodating. Great location across from Millennium park. All I can say is that all the establishments from the Gage group have exceeded my expectations. Good job!

Came in on Saturday evening with reservations..seated promptly..with what followed was a 5 star evening from the excellent wait staff to the food! Ohhh! My I ordered the 18 oz rib eye rare.. it was the BEST rib eye I've ever eaten in Chicago! Trust me I've been to many great steak houses here but this steak was supreme! Perfect crust of sea salt & crushed black pepper so tender it sliced like butter! This is my new go to for an amazing dining experience!

VALET???? Not Really...

Don't be fooled by the fact that Yelp shows valet at The Gage. They share a valet service with The University club on Monroe, who by the way charges us $32 to park our car in the lot across the street that was advertising $16 (Yep, we paid double!!)

Other than that, we love The Gage. The food was fantastic and it's always a lively atmosphere.

I came to The Gage for a private event that was being hosted in the downstairs space.

This is a gastropub which accommodates diners and bar goers. It is a dark space with a bar area and tables for dining. The wooden interior is warm and there are a few televisions.

The downstairs space is small and separated with one area for the bar and another smaller room for an even more intimate experience. This space was used for a presentation that was able to go on while a DJ played music back in the bar area. There was a couple televisions down here that I requested be turned on and they checked with the host to make sure this was ok. Service was friendly and prompt. They also provided a small cheese and meat platter area for the event.

pics.caption: Private room in the downstairs area.

review.des:
As you can see from my prior reviews, I have been here several times for both lunch and dinner, but, this was not one of my favorite dinners. This was my most recent visit with my family of four for dinner. I had a reservation and was seated in the rear of the restaurant nearest to the kitchen.  

Things started off well, but, soon became a disappointment during my entrée. As usual I enjoyed my two habanero margaritas for $13 each. The $18 mussels and $8 PBR pickles were also good as usual. We all enjoyed our bottle of Cave Springs Pinot Noir for $56. But my Peking Duck for $34 was a disappointment. The duck was over cooked and tough. I would not recommend the Peking Duck for dinner here. My other family members had the hanger steak for $21, the bison ribs for $18 and the venison burger for $18. My other family members, who have been here with me many times before were also disappointed with their entrees compared to our past respective experiences. Although we were not sure, but, one of my family members thought he got food poison from his dinner. My other family members or I did not get food poison so it may be unrelated. Anyway, we felt this place has gone down in quality a little bit.  

Maria's service was also a bit slow possibly because she was overwhelmed with her table service inclusive of ours. My total bill less gratuities was $279. I would probably return here for lunch, but, not for dinner. I would not give up on this place, since I have met the owner Billy Lawless several years ago.

My boyfriend and I came in for lunch. The host was very kind and sat us promptly, also making small talk. A+ for his service.

However, the server who came over seemed quite distracted. We ordered the bison tartare, scotch egg, turkey club sandwich, and gazpacho. The gazpacho was great.

At $20+ dollars for the tartare, I expected the dish to be perfect. It was hilariously under seasoned, and the plating was absolutely atrocious. It looked like dog food on a plate.

The scotch egg... was a disaster. The egg itself was horrendously overcooked. The egg whites were gray and the yolks were so overcooked that when you touched them with a fork, they would crumble into yolk powder. We explained this to the server, who not only seemed confused but also tried to tell me how a scotch egg is prepared; he said that the egg was supposed to be hard boiled. I work in the restaurant industry, and have years of food service (both cooking and serving) experience. There is a clear difference between a hard boiled egg and an overcooked one. Notwithstanding, a scotch egg should be cooked with a medium boiled egg. The server clearly did not know this, and was very dismissive. "The egg has to be cooked hard boiled so that we can shape the sausage around it so that it sticks." Clearly you don't know how this works.

As far as other service notes go: He rang in the turkey club incorrectly, and we ended up with some spicy chicken sandwich (which was good, but incorrect). The server also took forever to bring us the check, even though I had asked for it. I saw him walking around with drinks, cleaning empty tables, and calculating his tips from other checks.

Pretty disgraceful, and you can tell that the standard is not set very high. Pathetic.
Brunch on the patio was great. Coffee was great and replenished often, Bloody Mary was tasty. I'd go again for brunch anytime! Great service, great spot.

First time in Chicago and first time here. Service was impeccable!!! The lady hostess or possible manager went above and beyond coming to us stating that she "saw a man eyeing bags" (as we were sitting outside) and had us place bags over our chairs. Our server - Archy - also went above and beyond! He actually gave us referrals to go to without us even asking. Not only the food was amazing but so was the service.....oh and the bloody Mary's are to DIE FOR! A must go while in town!!

Fantastically fast service for such a busy place. I sat down and had a drink appear before me with in 2 minutes of ordering. It was wall to wall and I was surprised service was so flawless. Didn't have any food but the seat next to me at the bar had oysters that looked really good. A must try for next time!!!!

pics.caption: The purest ice I've ever had in a drink. It was crystal clear.

review.des: Went for lunch here. Nice, friendly service. A lot of good lunch options. I ordered a lobster roll $28. It was very good. Recommended for lunch.

I thoroughly enjoyed my lunch at The Gage. Especially since their wine pours are larger than most! I ordered the sandwich of the day-skirt steak with avocado mayo, onions, cheese and lettuce. It came with fries and a pickle. I ate the whole thing and even scooped up the mayo that fell off! The meat was tasty and the fries crispy. If you read my review you know I like my fries crispy! It came fast which was conducive to my lunch hour. Bar stool was a little uncomfortable but they have regular seating. Upscale but had a decent lunch priced menu.

Roasted red pepper soup was very good, service was excellent, but the roasted beet salad was a huge letdown. I've had much tastier ones at much lesser restaurants. It was incredibly bland- barely any vinaigrette and just a couple orange pieces, with bland buratta cheese. Absolutely needed more vinaigrette, oranages, nuts, more arugula, or more tasteful cheese. I basically just ate a ton of beets.

We happened upon this place and we thoroughly enjoyed our food, the atmosphere and the customer service was excellent. The crab cakes with poached eggs on their brunch menu were divine and the Bloody Mary was exceptional. The service was attentive and there was great choice of food, would highly recommend this place.

Came in for lunch today for my weekly brother sister lunch date. My brother got their before me and was sitting in the high tops by the bar. After I arrived we sat around for a good 5-7 minutes until a waitress came by and asked if we were helped and we said no. She said that she could take our drink and food orders if we're ready.

I ordered the cheeseburger with cheddar and instead of fries I got Caesar salad. My brother ordered the turkey club with mashed potatoes instead of fries. After we placed our order our waiter came by and introduced himself and said that he had gone ahead and put a rush on our order.

The food was really good. The portions were pretty big for lunch options but we enjoyed everything. The mashed potatoes were on point.

We ended up ordering dessert chocolate moose and the waiter offered us complimentary espresso/coffee for having to wait for a while.

The food was great but the service could have been a tad bit better during the weekday lunch hour. I do plan on being back and hopefully giving an additional star for my next dining experience

Went here for brunch and can't say I was blown away. I think there are plenty of better (and significantly cheaper) places to grab brunch in Chicago. Hopefully the dinner menu is significantly more impressive.

Wonderful food. The blackberry tart appetizer was amazing.

We had a long layover in Chicago and took the orange line in to town from Midway.

We were seated right away. Everyone from the front hostess/host to our waiter Trent were lovely, upbeat and very attentive.

The Amish chicken added to the salad was so delicious.

Great place!

We were killing some time between a wedding and a reception. 4 of us were lucky to find 4 seats at the bar and were served instantly. Beer was cold and the cocktails were made with precision.

We waited maybe 10 minutes for an order of French fries and fried pickles. They came out hot, tasted great, and went quick.

If you're looking for good fries cold beers and pickles, this is the spot.
Great food & atmosphere! The staff was very friendly and accommodating. Our server Olivia was great! We'll definitely be back on our next trip to Chicago

Went here on a Valentine's date with my girlfriend. The food was outstanding.

We got the soup, burger and charred peppers. All of them were cooked well, the burger and fries was particularly outstanding. Would highly recommend for a dinner date

pics.caption: The Gage Burger. Perfectly cooked patty and fries on the softest and tastiest bun.

review.des:
Came here when I went to go see a show at the Harris with a friend. He paid for everything, which was awesome, cuz you know... expensive ;) HA!

So we went during Oktoberfest, and we both had some prime cut meats, some delicious sides, and delicious desserts. We also ordered some yummy wine. Mmmmmm

Decor is nice, and so is the service, though I did feel out of place since I wouldn't be able to afford this meal. It can get a little loud in the front room, so try to get seated in the back.

It's nice for a romantic date or a pre-show dinner. I enjoy it enough to recommend!

Came into Gage after leaving Cindy's Rooftop which is located right next door. My BFF and I sat at the bar to have lunch. Since we had already had our fill of drinks at Cindy's we opted for water and ordered their Cinnamon bun for our app (so non conventional) and we shared the open faced Lump Crab sandwich. Let me tell you that this was a great item to share if your not starving and want something light. They did not disappoint on the crab either. Lots of it! Our bartender was great and gave us great ideas on where to visit in the city.

A true 5 star experience. From the attentive waitstaff to the impeccable food, everything was on point.

Food wise, we tried the creamed corn (amazing!), the scotch egg, poutine (eh, salty and soggy), mussels (just ok), lamb shank (melt in your mouth but WAY too much), and the BBQ ribs (YUM! Slight hint of sweet but more spice, amazing texture). For dessert we had the apple crumble which was beyond good (buttery cake with smooth vanilla ice cream) and the chocolate mousse (strong coffee flavor and crunchy toppings).

Service wise, we loved that they cleaned the table and changed the cutlery after every course. They also gave us both desserts for free since we were celebrating a birthday! Loved it!

pics.caption: Melt in your mouth lamb shank but HUGE portion
Creamed corn - could have kept eating this all night!

review.des: Went for lunch and definitely enjoyed it. The poutine was some of the best I've had in the city and a welcome change from the normal slop. The club sandwich was truly amazing and one would struggle to eat the entire thing. Fish and chips as if you were eating them in London. The elk chop was cooked nicely but the chimichurri left much to be desired. If you get nothing else, get the chocolate creme brûlée. Will definitely go back.
Had the Scotch Egg, poutine, and fish and chips. Everything was amazing. Probably the best poutine I've ever had in my life

Service was fantastic - the staff here are all super friendly and knowledgeable. We had at least 2 managers stop by to either bring food or pour more wine and make conversation to make sure we were happy. The food was excellent. For an app we got the poutine which was delicious. For dinner I had the filet and my husband had the elk. We also ordered the mashed potatoes which were super creamy and delicious. The green beans were awesome and the chocolate mousse for dessert was out of this world. So glad we decided to stop for dinner after spending the day at the art institute right down the street. Can't wait to come back to Chicago to have another meal at The Gage!

Stopped by for brunch before 2pm Hamilton show. I ordered the Eggs Benedict - house made pork merguez, Bolo muffin, poblano hollandaise, sliced tomato served with a side of Gage potatoes. The benedict was really good. Merguez is a sausage and a bit spicy. I don't particularly enjoy warm tomato slices and set those aside, but the hollandaise was fantastic. What nearly stole the show were the Gage potatoes -  fried potato bites topped with morsels of soft white cheese (I don't recall the type of cheese). Simply delicious!!! The coffee was equally good.

Sunday a bit after 12pm was quite busy, but the service was prompt and we didn't feel rushed. The venison burger has a reputation for being a damn good burger and I was tempted to try it, but decided otherwise. I'd like to taste more of the menu. I'll be back.

We went to this place for a weekend brunch to celebrate a birthday. It was amazing! They took really good care of us and even came out with a special little dessert platter for the birthday guy. Every dish we had was delicious and had truly ample portions. We also tried the banana bread and cinnamon roll, which I HIGHLY recommend. We were comfortably full until dinner! We are vegetarians also, and a nice brunch with multiple vegetarian options can be hard to find, but the gage was perfect! Will definitely be back on our next trips to Chicago!
Excellent service by a very knowledgeable waiter.   The entrees came out hot, beautifully presented and full of flavor.  Highly recommended

Having been to The Gage numerous times over the years, I'm quite surprised I never wrote a review!

The one common thread amongst all the Billy Lawless restaurants is the secret formula for selecting all the best front of house staff. The service from everyone is fantastic.

And special props to the runners at The Gage. They really are so efficient and friendly, and perfectly complement the servers.

My most recent visit was a Saturday around 2pm. The place was packed, but we were seated promptly.

The food was really exceptional. My best mate and I both started off with the luxuriously rich butternut squash soup, topped with crunchy pumpkin seeds and a dash of subtly spicy oil. He then had what was truly the best corned beef hash, with generous chunks of potatoes and meaty goodness.

I opted for the mushroom sammy with chips. It was ginormous, so much so that I ate the second half the next evening for dinner. The flavors bleshed wonderfully and it was actually tastier than the half I had in the restaurant.

We split the creamy chocolatey minty Coupe. Nicely balanced with a crunchy cookie, not too sweet.

I'm already looking forward to my next visit, likely over Christmas with the fam.

The Gage is one of my fav go-to spots in the Loop for after work drinks, dinner, lunch, everything, since I started working and living in the Loop. They make one of the best Old Fashioneds in the city.

Sure, it can be a little pricey for dinner, but it's worth it. The atmosphere is cozy and inviting, convivial, and you can't beat it.

Highlights are the Burger, the Catch of the Day, the fish fry, the Scotch Egg, the Thai Curry, the Old Fashioned and their Gibson. I love it all!

I told myself that i had to try The Gage if i came back to Chicago for all the good reviews and nice pictures from Yelp. So i had lunch here with my friend during the Christmas weekend. I really liked the ambiance of this type of gastro pub, especially during holiday season which made it feel so classy and warm.
I ordered chips which is house Fries an curry gravy to munch on while waiting for my friend to come. Fries was very crunchy, thin cut and well seasoned. The curry gravy was too salty and i didn't think it went well with the fries. I later ordered scotch egg to share then got a sea scallops salad like how the waitress recommended and my friend got The Gage Venison burger. I totally loved my salad dish, the scallops were well-cooked, beets was sweet with little touch of sour yuzu sauce. My friend's burger was also very flavorful. I did not like my scotch egg. I wish the egg was half boiled or runny yolk. The grain outside of the egg was too salty and hard.
Very good mussels with curry sauce!!! Just needed some bread for dipping. Unfortunately only had craft beers available.

Note: my review is based SOLELY off the bar service.

Bartenders here are the best (special shout-out to Scott)! If you haven't, come and try the malört from here. It's a Chicago experience, for sure

I came in for a business lunch, and this place offers great food selections! The menu had specials for the St. Patricks weekend, so I went with the corned beef sandwich. The sandwich was sized perfectly. The corned beef was tender and cooked to my liking. Fries were crispy and nicely seasoned. The waiter was knowledgeable on the menu and gave us his favorites to help decide on what to order. We came in before noon, which helped us get seated right away. It got packed by noon time. Service was quick and friendly. Awesome pub!

No complaints with The Gage. Quality food and drink in a dimly lit ambiance, or in the summer it's great for drinks and a cheese board out on the patio. The menu is seasonal and always changing which is awesome- their dishes always look and sound delicious. It's definitely one of the better restaurant options along Michigan avenue.

pics.caption: Cherry Almond Cake with molten center

review.des:
Best corn beef hash ever, moist and flavorful. Great Bloody Mary and nice selection of local brews. Service was on point . Atmosphere was very friendly and professional. My girl had the BLT, nice twist to the original with a little kick of spicy.

We did not try the biscuits or cinnamon rolls but everyone around us was getting them. Next time we will get them for sure.

It's been awhile since I've been here and I am glad I came back. I've experienced two important "firsts" at The Gage. My very first dish of fish & chips was at The Gage, back in '08. Had it again tonight and it was just as good, if not better than it was 10 years ago (and this time I wasn't on a college budget, yay!). My first brunch was also at The Gage and I intend on coming back to relive that experience. English transplants and old money Chicagoans call this place home. Overall, the vibe is great and I definitely recommend people coming here for if you're looking for a great spot on Michigan.

Why isn't there an option for zero stars? Zero stars is what I rate this restaurant. We'll, let's be fair, there was a nice warm welcome, the restaurant was quite unique, and we were down to our table in a timely fashion. So... Let's say half a star.

That's where the magic ends. We sat for the next twenty minutes unacknowledged by what seemed like the entire staff with my lovely date. Servers walked by, backwaiters, sommelier, and then a manager. He even made eye contact without me as I made my best, "umm... Hello?" face. That's it.

I even had enough time to shop for a restaurant that might want to serve guests. My lovely date and I got up, put our costs back on, and began to exit the restaurant. On our way out, the same manager even grinned at me as I could only furl my eyebrows in disappointment and shake my head at him.

I notified the hostess that our table would be available as we were no longer wanting to done with them. She sheepishly smiled and confirmed the name to mark in her system that the table was no longer in use. Again, the same manager makes eye contact with me... I did make sure to speak loud enough for him to hear me over the restaurant commotion. Again I shake my head at him. Again I receive no acknowledgment. I stand outside and couldn't help but notice how oblivious they all were to the situation in their own restaurant.

No worries, though... Thankfully, just down the street I found Remington's. Where we received the same warm welcome... and then proper, professional service and lovely food. So, happy ending, I suppose!

We were staying at The Palmer House during sub zero weather and wanted awesome food a short walk from our hotel. The Gage lived up to the hype.

Everyone we encountered (from front desk onward) was genuinely pleasant and engaging.
Best part of the evening? Our server Wes! He was next level: great personality, attentive (in spite of pre-show theater rush) and passionately knowledgeable about all food / wine options.

One word of caution: my wife & I each had an app, entree, side & split 1 dessert. Major stomach aches ensued. Maybe we are just not Big City foodies;-)

Ive been wanting to try this place out for a while but im not sure I will return.  I made a brunch reservation but I am not convinced that the food was good enough to justify the price point.  Drinks were decent and the ambiance was nice.  The honey glazed cheese biscuit was delicious as a starter- I will not lie.  However, I think that chilaquiles were a little dry and needed some salsa or some sort of sauce and the roasted mushroom sandwhich was bland. It took our waiter quite a while to get salsa when we had asked, I had to go grab him as he was watching the game on the TV, which I didn't appreciate.

Great evening at The Gage. We were seated in the back room near the fireplace where it's cozy and not too noisy for good conversation. Started with great cocktails and moved on to the luscious striped bass special over romescu, great fish n chips and amazing Brussel sprouts with apple cream. Their special apple crisp for two was served with cider ice cream in the side.
The service was stellar. The atmosphere and food were terrific. I have found a new favorite.

The Gage is in a great location and has food to match. The room is nice looking and comfortable.  Our lunch group tried several dishes and they were all good.  Our knowledgable server, Jeffrey, offered suggestions and explained the menu.  He even pointed out they make their own ice cream on the cherry pie skillet, which was amazing.  A very enjoyable lunch!

Had the peach and plum salad and it was great, just the right amount of fruit and greens.  The coconut curry was delicious and both were gluten free.  Our waiter was very kind and we had a great spot on their patio.  Definitely a spot to come back to.

You worry about a place like this based on its location that it's going to jump the shark and aim to cater to tourists, but thankfully The Gage choses to do it's own thing and has been for over 10 years.

A gastro pub before their really was such a thing. Quality cocktails, attentive & knowledgeable bar tenders and servers, high quality ingredients, and non pretentious- but complex inspired food.

The buffalo chicken sandwich featured grilled chicken with a zippy buffalo sauce, super thinly sliced pieces of celery, and just the right touch of blue cheese. Easily the best Buffalo Chicken sandwich I've had. The simplicity and quality of the ingredients took something that's normally dodgy and made it into a great meal. The curry and chips is also phenomenal and I always get it when I'm there. If you've never had this at a pub, The Gage is a great place to try it as there's is awesome. If you're not with a group and don't want to deal with a mountain of chips on your own, ask for a cup of the curry sauce with your sandwich/burger instead of the appetizer.

They feature local breweries on tap and right now they are feautung Revolutions Gagelicious which is an exclusive collab pale ale that's delicious and perfect for a hot day after walking around Michigan ave. Their cocktails are not to be overlooked either, see what's featured as they are almost always crowd pleasers.

pics.caption: Great feature cocktail tying in with the U2 concert.

review.des:
Always have had a great experience at the Gage. Usually go during the work week for lunch - if you don't make a reservation or get there by 11:30 it is always filled. Always been a fan of bar seating, as it offers the full menu and has 2 TVs which can catch me up on current sports and news events.

In regards to the menu, my go to has always been the smoked salmon BLT. It is easily one of the best I've ever had and comes with a side of chips. I've tried a few other things periodically and none of them have disappointed.
Place is great 4 late night dinner. Lavender Cola & DR Moody Tongue Porter was amazing. Don't miss out delicious Scotch Egg & House Poutine

Looking for a last meal in Chicago after visiting Cloud Gate, we decided on burgers and the Gage. Best choice we could've made.

We booked an Opentable reservation and were able to be seated right away, just beating the bulk of the lunch rush.

Although I think an Irish restaurant, the vibe seemed a little more French to me. Overall just classic and classy. By the business casual attire and suits and clamor of numbers, this is totally the spot to be for business lunches.

Ordering was super easy. They had Half Acre Galactic Double Daisy Cutter. I practically came to Chicago for this beer and they didn't have it at the taproom the day of my visit. They also had Zombie Dust. No brainer beverage choices for me.

My food order was also a no brainer. I had to go with the venison burger. It came out on a lush, butter bun in full medium rare glory. It was a pleasure to eat. It was served with fries and a pickle.

Our server was friendly, efficient and polished briefly chatting us about the beers. Our water glasses were constantly refilled. We were even checked on my presumably the manager. That's the type of experience you always want.

Albeit brief, it was one of my favorite meals on my trip to Chicago.

pics.caption: Close up on the venison burger

review.des: I can't believe I never reviewed this place!  This place is a bustling establishment with great food and service. I have never seen it empty, but you can always get a table.  I recommend that you make reservations in advance.  This place is fantastic for a business lunch, dinner with friends and is a hit with out of the guests.  I have never had a bad meal here.  The specials are always terrific too. I have in her over a dozen times, and it is my favorite go-to slam dunk choice for a business lunch. The portions are significant, so you may be sleepy after lunch or be too full to eat dinner.   One of the best bets in town!!

Food was delicious - perfect for adults and teens. Slightly upscale in terms of ambiance and service but service was lacking. Took a long time for someone to greet us and take drink orders after arriving. Food took forever - but people arriving after us received food before us. I'd like to think it was a fluke but we did have to keep checking in with our waitress. I'd still go back for the food but would request a different server.

After trying multiple times I finally had a chance to eat at The Gage. Due to reservation times available and our after dinner plans we arrived at the restaurant at 4:45 PM. I expected the place to be empty because it was still early for dinner but the bar area was packed with happy hour customers.

My boyfriend and I ordered the fried pickle appetizer after seeing it on a table nearby. These were the best fried pickles I've tried. The coating was fluffy and pickles weren't overly salty. The dipping sauce was good too.

For dinner I had the Amish chicken. The chicken was good but my favorite part of the dish was the vegetables that accompanied it.

My boyfriend ordered the Elk which was good too. I had a bite since I haven't had Elk before and found it tasted a lot like beef. He also ordered the brussel sprout side which was delicious.

Overall, I left understanding the hype over The Gage. I'll be back!

The Gage is located in a great location for anyone visiting the Art Institute, the Chicago Symphony, or Millennium Park.

The interior is very nice and the bar is inviting, but we ate a table for lunch.  The prices are reasonable for the area and it offers a very nice wine list.

I had the fish and chips while my brother had the turkey club and soup.  The fish was excellent, very tender with a nice beer batter coating and fried perfectly. The presentation was also kind of cool, in rolled up newspaper. The fries were really tasty also.

My brother did not enjoy his food as much.  He liked the Turkey Club (although they included onions which he asked them to remove) but the soup was kimd of bland.  He also had some odd service.  For some reason they took his soup spoon when they brought a steak knife (which he did not need).

For dessert, we had this apple crumble and frozen yogurt that was heavenly.  Overall, a really good dining experience.
The best food service selection.  Brunch, Lunch, or Supper.  We love The Gage.  Here today for Brunch having the perfect breakfast sandwich and Gage potatoes. Already booked supper next week.

The Gage is my absolute favorite place to have lunch in Chicago. The menu is always so modern and crisp and simply delicious. I went with my mother, a concierge at the Marriott Marquis in South Loop, and we had a phenomenal experience from beginning to end. The staff was very warm and friendly towards us and our wonderful waiter, Manny, was eager to guide our decisions on what to order so that we could have the most memorable experience at The Gage. We started off with a tomato and kale salad topped with a fresh ball of mozzarella tossed in vinaigrette. Next came out our main courses which was the lobster roll for me and a spicy chicken sandwich for my mother which manny was considerate enough to accommodate her new diet by substituting the regular bun that comes with it for lettuce. It did not take away from her food at all which I had tried and it was so refreshing and tasty. Previously I had the lobster roll from The Gage but since then they have revamped the menu which is quite a regular occurrence here. Instead of it being served warm as it had been, it was served chilled with creme fresh which made it all the more enjoyable. My mother and I felt light and well nourished after eating at The Gage and there was nothing left to take home. The reason there is no picture attached of my mothers meal was because she was so eager to have it and started before I could get a picture. Before I conclude I want to mention that Manny was able to convince my mother, someone who has hated cheesecake all of her life, to order the cheesecake. It was so airy, fresh, and perfectly done I could not write this review without mention of it. Unfortunately, yesterday was the last day that it would appear on the menu because the strawberry season is coming to an end, and the contemporary chef at The Gage believes that it's time for something new to be added in its place in order to consistently have a vibrant menu at this establishment. The cheesecake was probably the best one both me and my mother have ever had and we have Manny to thank for persuading us to order it. Special thanks to Manny for the great experience, he truly is wonderful, and it is clear to see that he is a fresh face aspiring to become something great in restaurant management. It is obvious that he is immersing himself in the best way possible learning from some of the most well respected and successful restaurant owners such as Bill from the Gage. Definitely an afternoon to remember.

On a lonely December night I walked in, alone. I was wanting to try this place for a while and I'm glad I did. While the prices are comparable to most Michigan Avenue restaurants, the uniqueness of the menu and the selection of beers and wines are are worth every penny. I ordered the Scotch egg and a porter to start and followed with the venison burger and a Tempranillo. Food was amazing and the service was on par for a single guest at the bar. If you haven't yet, you must.

This place is so on point I don't even know where to begin.

The drinks were huge huge pours. And the whiskey selection was insane. I felt like I was back in Kentucky. So many rare bottles and at reasonable prices!

Get the fish and chips!! They were out of this world! Omg the homemade tartar sauce was the ultimate compliment.

I will be back here every Friday. Such a great after work spot.

I recently had my 50th birthday party here and must post about our amazing experience. Josh was a great communicator while putting the event together, and answered questions promptly, and with clarity.
We held the party in the basement and had plenty of room for 70+. The bar and surrounding areas were spacious and comfortable. The bartenders and floor captain gave us impeccable service. The food and drinks were perfect. Our friends and family have been posting about the event for two days. Simply amazing!

Looks: 5 stars if you dig traditional style, white tablecloths, and mahogany-paneled rooms. Drinks menus are ensconced in thick, supple leather portfolios. Tables are appropriately sized (no cramming patrons like sardines here), and set just so.

Food: 3 stars. We had brunch there on a Sunday. No haute cuisine, just line cooks cranking it out. Sorry everyone, but deep-fried, breaded pickle slices is... weird. The scotch egg was overdone. The Irish breakfast's meats were bland; I was looking forward to the black pudding our waitress told us it contained but it was white pudding instead, a peculiar british abomination which was barely discernable from the mealy bangers. On the plus side, the eggs were cooked as they should be, their yolks appropriately runny. The BLT was all right. The coffee was good. Prices were not excessive.

Service: 2 stars. Coffee cup sat empty unless I asked. Our waitress was pleasant but getting her attention was not an easy task.

Bottom line: Unremarkable food and service in posh digs.

Such a great place! A little more on the expensive side but so worth it and great location! I love their Roasted Amish Chicken, very fresh and flavorful. The service was great with a nice casual atmosphere on the patio.

To go anywhere for dinner in Chicago it's best to make a reservation. And I do mean anywhere! We were fresh off waiting 45 min for a rooftop bar that we were told we didn't need reservations for when it turned out we did. So we made a reservation here and went. I asked for a booth or a patio table. We were in somewhat of a booth. Our server was great and down to earth. The whole place was a bit pretentious and if you can tell by what I ordered we were hoping to go to more of a grille place but it was good none the less. If you're craving a $65 a la carte steak this is your place.
I had a delicious Steak Sandwich and "the" best service from Les.  The sandwich was one of the specials and the steak was grilled and cut perfectly.  I was happy to enjoy local beers on tap too!

I cannot say enough good things about the Gage!  After a reservation mix up, the staff at the Gage quickly accommodated our group of 10 in their downstairs space.  The space was beautiful, staff was amazing and food was phenomenal.  They even comped our deserts without asking as a way to apologize for the mix up - completely unnecessary but much appreciated.  Will recommend this restaurant to anyone that asks!

This review is solely for their fish and chips. That fish was cooked beautifully. Best fish and chips I've ever had, better than the ones I've had in London.

Service was attentive, slipped in for lunch around 2pm and there was plenty of seating.

Came in for a light lunch. Soup of the day appeared to be frozen peas, carrots and corn with some potatoes and was bland. Wedge salad was fine, but the dressing was watery. Dining companion said her chicken orzo soup was also bland, but loved the smoked salmon blt. Hostess was unfriendly. We really wanted to love this place. Although we may not have ordered their signature dishes, if something's not up to par, don't put it in the menu! Location is great and they were good about knowing what was safe for my celiac disease (gluten free) needs, so plus a star for that.

Unfortunately this place has taken a steep fall since I first came by 7 years ago. Beverage offerings are no longer exciting. Wine list is overpriced and boring. Beer options are over priced and much more aimed at gouging tourists. Steep decline.

Time to make a change to whoever is managing this. Used to be a great place. Now it's just a ripoff place with overpriced wine and beer.

Too bad. Will go elsewhere when I'm in this part of town or friends come in.

I'm a jaded Chicagoan when it comes to restaurants along Michigan Ave, but this place I will absolutely make an exception for! It gets quite crowded during the dinner hour, and lunch, but it works on both ends of the day! I've been here once shortly after it opened for the day for a business lunch; we had a nice quiet table, and attentive, but not overly-fussy service. Their burgers are EXCELLENT! This is also one of the few places that knows how to do cooked-to-order burgers right!

This place gets quite lively in the evening, but it's still a great spot for dinner or an after-work-drink. Their old fashioned is one of the best i've had in a while! Even though the place buzzes and gets a little crowded in the evenings (especially if you're eating in the bar/cocktail area) the service is still excellent.

I knocked a star off, because it can add up very quickly price-wise, but great food, great service and excellent drinks!

Don't miss The Gage if you're in Chicago!!  Service was great and informative, very helpful!  We didn't have to wait but they were packed shortly after we arrived!  We started with the Scotch Egg and it was full of flavor and is quite large!  The fish & chips were cooked perfectly and I would love to go back and try many other menu items.  Another person in our group ordered the venison burger and it really packs the flavor!!  Amazing!!  I will definitely order the burger next time!

Jack and Jimmy are so awesome! I believe I had the bison tartare with toast. Omg SO delicious. The drinks Jack made me were also great and exactly how I like them. I had conversations with both Jack and Jimmy who made me feel comfortable but still have me my space to enjoy my meal. I look forward to coming back to this place and hanging out and trying some main dishes in the future. I am always a fan of restaurants that have great atmosphere, company, and food. Well this place has a perfect combo of all three!

I went to The Gage today for St. Patrick's Day. They had the entire restaurant decorated and even hired bagpipers to play while you are eating lunch. The entire atmosphere of the restaurant was filled with joy and celebration. The food was outrageous and my corn beef sandwich was very lean. The staff were very friendly. I can't wait to come back here and celebrate St. Patrick's Day next year.

This was my second visit here and it did not disappoint. The wedge salad-ohhhh the wedge salad! It was the best salad I've ever had. I also ordered the steak and it was prepared deliciously. It did not surprise me at all how crowded this place was. I can't wait for my next trip back!

I now better understand why The Gage is always crowded. They have great cocktails, good food and fantastic service. We loved their Habanero Margarita and venison burgers. The venison burger is served medium rare which is the best way to eat deer meat. It was a mouthful of deliciousness with Gouda cheese, beautifully simmered sweet onions and jalapeños. Their fries were fresh, crispy and non greasy, but I wish the portion was slightly bigger. We sat in the packed bar area and received prompt attention within three minutes. Our lovely female server was pleasant and kept water glasses full.

This place is amazing.
Caution!!! Extremely delicious food
Drinks are top notch..
Only reason for four stars is the service, no dedicated server and they take long to check on you.

The VENISON BURGER IS TO-die-for. Their lamb chops are juicy and delicious. We went for brunch (packed) and then came back the week after for more off their menu :).
It's super packed, or at least when I went there so make a reservation to make sure you don't have to wait.
Yummy stuff, cool crowd, okay the venison is the best. Did I mention that?

Service and food were wonderful!  I had the Far & Away cocktail, the rockcrab and avo toast, and the roast chicken. The cocktail was amazing, pretty glass, light and refreshing with a good amount of champagne.  The toast was SO good. The chicken was beautifully plated and delicious. Personal preference of not liking jalapeños in the cornbread side. I absolutely loved this place. The atmosphere was just what I was hoping for on a Friday night in downtown Chicago. Lots of people, solid food and drinks.
