I love the atmosphere! It's very gastropubby featuring an abundance of wood, tile, and brick. The Venison burger is one of the best I have ever had. On another visit the staff was accommodating in that I was able to order a butcher board selection for lunch. The elk was superb and it was a nice portion; however, in my opinion it was under seasoned. Currently the menu shows the soup available in one size for both lunch and dinner. I recommend asking how large the serving is because I saw a bowl of soup and it was one of the largest servings I have ever seen.

The Managers from this restaurant reached out to me the following day, and gave me a full refund, which was very nice of them to do. I appreciate the time they took to speak to me and apologize for the bad experience. Thank you!

SUCH good customer service. I can't remember the name of our waitress but she has a tattoo on her hand.. But man, what a talker. She was so kind and helpful.

We ordered the burger, sandwich, and gumbo because they all sounded so good and then got the stolk egg as an appetizer. App was soooooo good. In order from best to worst, I was say sandwich, burger, then gumbo.

I stopped by for lunch yesterday and brunch this morning. Prices are fair for the quality of food. I had the chilaquiles with are a popular dish in town. The buttermilk biscuits are so good.
My wife ordered the eggs Benedict with pork belly on a bagel. Very good experience overall.
Saw social media reviews of this place and had to give it a try while in the theater district waiting to see Hamilton. Was not disappointed.

pics.caption: Well pleased with the fish of the day and chips.
Great dinner with the family here!

review.des: I had brunch here a few months ago ( which was amazing). So we decided to go for dinner since we were in town again. I had the lamb and my husband had the elk. All amazing. Our server Wes was also great. He was very helpful and recommendations were great! Would recommend this place to anyone!

I mostly like The Gage except for the noise. It's hard to have a conversation. The menu is more bar food than white table cloth. The wedge salad seemed to have a poppyseed dressing rather than blue cheese dressing. wasn't impressed with them this time

I love this place. Great food right on the edge of Millenium Park. I had the Elk last night and it was one of the best cuts of meat I have ever had. The waitstaff is all very nice and they know what they are talking about when you ask them a question. They have a great selection of local beers to sample, and the bar is very clean and neat.

I absolutely love The Gage.  I live in Cleveland, Ohio and make a point of going there every time I'm in Chicago.  Their corned beef hash with poached eggs and hollandaise sauce is sublime. Even with so many dining choices in Chicago, my first choice is always The Gage for brunch!

It was a cold and windy day in Chicago and I just walked a bunch of miles in Millennium Park.  Being super hungry, I stopped by a nearby restaurant, which happened to by the Gage.

Food:
I ordered the Traditional Creole Gumbo.  Amazing!

This meal was perfect for a cold day.  This dish will definitely get your taste buds tingling.  I highly recommend!

Sides Notes

Ambiance:
This place is on the noisy side and the bar was packed.

Service:
Bartender was very friendly.  Customer service was on point.

Overall:
If you're in the area, I recommend!

Across the street from millennium park is this gastro pub where you can grab a drink and some great food. A reservation was made ahead of time so when we got here there was no wait. Our waiter was very good, friendly and gave good recommendations on food and drinks.

Fried pickles - nice batter covered the pickles and gave it a nice crunch. A side of some type of spicy aioli made this appetizer just right.  

Steak and eggs - Amazing! Steak was cooked perfectly medium rare with some chimichurry sauce, pouched eggs on top of a bed of potatoes and asparagus. The combination of the runny egg on the asparagus, potatoes and some of that steak was fantastic. A rich flavor all in one bite.

Buffalo chicken sandwich - came with home made chips and a pickle. My wife enjoyed it because it had very good taste. A little messy but well worth it.

For a beer and some good food check this place out. You will not be disappointed.

We were able to get a patio table right away. I had the salmon BLT sandwich with a side salad. Salad was extremely boring and wilted.;( but the sandwich was very good. If the bread had been grilled with grill marks with a bit of oil olive it would have been amazing!
My daughter venison burger was very good according to her. She had the truffle fries that were super good.. just didn't know that would be an extra $4 though. I would recommend this place. Beats  an hr watch at Cindy's next door.
It's right across from millennium park.
This place definitely had the best chicken sandwich I've had in Chicago and I loved their selection of draft beers. I did think the menu was rather small for lunch. Overall great food and service!

The vibe is cool here. The menu has some unique items like a venison burger, which was delicious. The beer list was extensive, including local and imported gems.  I was glad I stumbled in to dodge the rain. I will come back.

We were running a bit late and the hostess was incredibly kind and accommodating when we called to say we would not make it on time.  When we let our waiter know we were trying to make it to the theatre, he was great about getting us out food, which was delicious, right away as well as the check.  We were truly impressed when the restaurant called us very shortly after we left to let us know we had left our credit card there and they would keep it in a safe until we arrived to pick it up...due to their prompt call, we did not get all the way back to the suburbs before we realized our mistake.
I would recommend The Gage to anyone- excellent on every level!

Just a fantastic place that gives you one hearty meal. I've been for dinner and brunch. Most recently it was for brunch and their chicken sausage on the traditional Irish breakfast is enough meat for my entire week.

The only downside is they no longer carry Moody . Hopefully that is just temporary.

pics.caption: The zucchini raisin bread is enough for a table of 4. One large slice is all you need to send you straight to heaven
The made in   beef hash was the best dish I've ordered this month. All the flavors paired together for supreme satisfaction.
Traditional Irish Breakfast. The brown bread ties everything together

review.des:
Had the coconut curry with seasonal veggies, which is vegan!!! I was not expecting them to have a vegan friendly option and was pleasantly surprised not just by that but also by how DELICIOUS the coconut curry was.

Service was exceptional as always.

Stopped in for lunch on a Saturday and was not disappointed. Upscale gastropub was beautifully appointed, clean with attentive, will dressed waitstaff. I say at the bar and was promptly given cold water, asked if I'd like a drink and handed a menu. Menu was a short list of brunch and lunch options. I wanted a burger and was stuck between beef and venison. I asked the bartender and she recommend the venison. Man it was awesome! Had to be a half pound, cooked perfectly medium rare, nice roll. The fries were awesome. Best burger in a long time. Based on my lunch I would highly recommend the Gage for any meal. Thoroughly enjoyed!

I was by myself, not at all up for hotel fare, and discovered, almost by accident, The Gage on S. Michigan.  First off, I was promptly seated without a reservation into an atmosphere of unexpectedly relaxed elegance that was just right after a day of business.  I started with the scotch eggs that were well prepared and matched with the right mustard. I followed with the scallops which were skillfully seared and so nicely done that I will admit I just enjoyed the aroma here and there throughout the meal.  The roasted corn was prepared with good smokey bacon that paired well with the scallops. For dessert I had the German chocolate cake -- almost too much for one diner.    I found the staff to be genuinely gracious and attentive but not obsequious or ever present.   I give The Gage my strongest recommendation.
Excellent food and service! Corned beef hash is the best I've ever had. The French toast was also amazing.

Yum yum yum! Went here for brunch and was able to get a table on the balcony. Everything was amazing. I had a yummy mimosa made with freshly squeezed orange juice and my friend had a perfect crafted bloody mary. We ordered an assortment of dishes to try including their famous scotch egg, brown butter banana nut bread, eggs benedict made with their house made pork sausage, and the Crab Louie sandwich. Everything was amazing but if you're looking to try something different definitely get the scotch egg. Its comes perfectly fried and with some bomb mustatd made with whole mustard seed. So tasty! The only thing that brought down the rating was the bees. We were pestered by them from the moment we sad down.

pics.caption: Eggs benedict with house made pork sausage and cheesy potatoes
Brown butter banana nut bread with whipped butter

review.des: A classic CHICAGO chop house but with a more interesting and varied menu. I had the elk chop - grilled perfectly to medium rare. The vegetable side dishes were also cooked perfectly. For a restaurant that was packed the food came out of the kitchen quickly. It was busy but we never felt rushed. As we discussed business plans over coffee the only waiter involvement was a coffee warm up. In summary - a great place this is now on my list of favorites. Oh - definitely make a reservation before you drop in

Our experience was superior from the moment we made our reservation to the moment we walked out the door. Service was excellent, atmosphere was perfect, and the food was outstanding. What a fabulous experience. Look no farther. We had the cheeseboard, butter lettuce salad, and fish and chips. We split our meal which was plenty of food, and our bill was $59. It was a special dinner to celebrate New Year's.
Dim lighting, great music and great food! I love everything about the mussels and the buffalo ribs!!!! Love everything.

The wife and I had dinner here before a play.  We started with the PEI mussels, which were surprisingly good this far from the ocean. Some were not fully opened and this should have been monitored better, but, again, this isn't exactly a seaside town so I apply a lower standard.  The use of a vindaloo sauce was excellent and the dipping bread was good, although a couple more slices of it would have been nice.  

I ordered the venison burger medium rare and it was very good.  I am aware of Yelp reviews stating that it is too dry. That was not a problem I had.  The only issue I had was that the bun fell apart and I had to finish the final third with knife and fork.

The wife ordered the fried pheasant special.  I tasted it and liked it. She said that some parts were dry, perhaps due to frying and uneven cooking. She did not like the pickled peach slices that came with the pheasant, they were over-pickled.

For drinks, the wife ordered a negroni before dinner. Not my favorite drink. She liked it but said the pour was weak.  

Service was excellent throughout the meal. The server obviously likes working there.

pics.caption: Soup of Day - Tomato with small Sausage pieces

review.des:
I was visiting Chicago for the weekend so I decided to take the missus out to dinner. After extensive research we settled on the gage cos we wanted the scotch eggs. Made a reservation for 915pm and we hopped in our rental car (big mistake), there's barely any street parking available downtown so we spent a while looking for parking, they didn't have valet and in the had to park in some parking garage a block away which cost $18 per hour.
Anyway sat down and our waiter Trent was veg nice and we settled on the Avocado & Crab toast, Scotch eggs to start and for the main we had the Thai coconut curry with Madagascar Prawns and the lamb which I ordered medium on the recommendation of our server. I also had a couple of Negroni's which were pretty good and my wife had the habanero margarita. The starters came out pretty quick, the scotch egg was okay. I felt it had a bit too much bread in the crust but it was yummy. The crab and avocado toast was a bit of a let down as I expected it to blow my mind. I'll skip that next time. The main took a while to come out. The curry was quite yummy my lamb came out medium rare and was a lil cold and but it was seasoned just right and next time I'll just ask for it medium well so that way it comes out medium. We ended up getting half our meal comped cos of the delay with the mains and also I had a chipped glass with my 2nd drink and drank a bit of glass but the manager apologized profusely and was very gracious. I really want to give them 4 stars but I think I'll have to come back and try the lamb again cooked medium and hopefully comes out hot.
P.S the cocktails here are pretty good so the bar gets 5 Stars and remember to just Uber cos parking is expensive
Excellent food in a relaxed atmosphere. I had the roasted chicken and finished with the carrot cake and peppermint tea. Even the tea excelled expectations.

I attended a small (under 50) wedding reception here (lower level). A great spot. I had a wonderful time, one of the best receptions I've ever been to. So when an old friend came into town, I highly recommended it as a place to meet up. Never disappoints. Great food, HIGHLY professional staff/service. Call ahead for reservations, because people clearly know this place is incredible. Wonderful food and cocktails!

A good spot in Chicago, trendy and chic ambience. The food was decent, a carrot ginger soup + Brussels sprouts and green beans made a nice vegetarian dinner. The green beans were a bit oily, but the sprouts were amazing (apple cream and toasted walnuts tied it all together). I'd come back here!
Good breakfast but not a huge selection. We had pancakes, bacon, and eggs Benedict. Great spot to grab drinks outside overlooking Millenium Park.
Easy to get in & dine here.  Right in the heart of Michigan Avenue.  Great sandwiches & burgers but in a classy setting.  Cocktails were very good as well.  Kind of an upscale burger joint.

Absolutely phenomenal establishment. I come from a family of restaurant connoisseurs, and I do tend to have high expectations- so this review means a lot. Phenomenal food and presentation (and quality and quantity), and exceptional service. Our waiter was Mike D, and he made this dining service top notch. He was professional, very personable, and very knowledgeable, from the wine list and pairings to each of the menu items. I have celiacs disease, so I am strictly gluten free, and he was fully prepared and ready to guide me through the menu and give suggestions.
We had the mussels- large portion size app for 2 in a delicious tomato broth. 5/5
Wedge salad- great palate cleanse. 4/5
They surprised us with a glass of champagne as an anniversary surprise and a palate cleanse, which was so remarkable.
And then we had the 18 oz bone in ribeye (grass fed)- which was PHENOMENAL.
Ended with espressos and Thomas got the layered brownie desert- which he said was amazing.
Overall, the food was phenomenal. And we are good snobs. Mike made our experience that much better. Will definitely recommend to others.

Best poutine Ive had thus far in Chicago. I also ordered the fish and chips. Fish could have definitely been seasoned more, but the batter was the perfect texture. Wait staff was very attentive. Decor was great. Overall a good dining experience.

Starting off our Chicago adventures with lunch at The Gage on a Friday afternoon. We stop in a few minutes before noon and we're lucky to snag a high top in the bar area with no wait. Looked like a good mix of business folks and tourist at this great spot.

Food: We ordered the Rueben sandwich with house made chips, the salmon BLT and the Farmers Salad. Food came out pretty quickly, we were happy with the selections. The Rueben had a thick cut of tender Corned Beef (versus thin slices) along with all the dressings. Smoked Salmon was interesting..a full BLT with slices of smoked salmon....seemed a little odd but the combination worked especially with the caper aioli. The salad was nice and loved the pieces of cheese and sliced ham. Good lunch selection and a great bar. We didn't sample any cocktails this time..hope to return before we leave!

Service: Great service, our server was very attentive, came by often and took good care of us.

Atmosphere: Trendy place, large bar area, with seating outside as well. There were quite a few parties dining outside..but for us Hawaii folks, 50 degrees is a little cold to dine al fresco!

Value: Good value for what you receive, right in line with prices for other establishments in the area that are similar in style. Most of the lunch options are priced below $20 which gives a lot of options to wide range of diners.

Overall: Good area, solid food, great staff, what more could you ask for!

pics.caption: Reuben Sandwich with extra thick cuts of Corned Beef

review.des:
A few friends and I ate at The Gage for a quick lunch, and overall, the food is tastyand inventive yet a bit too carb-heavy.

I read about this restaurant in a list of good lunch spots in the Loop, and they didn't let me down. We made sure to order the scotch egg and veal burger as recommended online - the scotch egg was a bit dry and disappointing, but the burger was absolutely delicious. Very good guality meat. The burrata was a big portion but not as flavorful as it could have been.

My friend ordered the poutine, which was heavy on cheese and not gravy. The eggplant sandwich was a mess of fried eggplant, bread and fries. The sandwich did not need all the bread, and half the food on the plate was wasted.

I really liked the service and vibe here, but this is not a "diet" restaurant! Wavered between 3 and 4 stars, but the vibe here was great so I would go again.

The Gage lives up to the echoes of their reputation.

With beautifully displayed brunch dishes, the beef hash to the "classic" burger is both downright dirty and satisfying.

This classy restaurant provides top notch service with great vibes and food. Leaving the joint a spot to not miss while in Chicago.

With a prime spot of being right next to the famous bean, they also have a hip coffee store to get black coffee for disgusting afterwards

Must visit!
This place has good food and a nice atmosphere but it's nothing too unique or special.

Wow, this restaurant certainly did not disappoint! My wife and I were in Chicago for our 5 year anniversary, we stopped by The Gage for some drinks and apps and they were so good!

We ordered the fried pickles and poutine fries. The pickles were very good but the poutine fries certainly stole the show!

I would highly recommend anyone to visit The Gage and we can't wait to come back and try more!
The service here was on point!  The food was great, I would definitely come again and recommend others!

My husband and I celebrated our 5 year anniversary here tonight and were both SO impressed. The second we sat down we were given complimentary champagne. Multiple staff came up to tell us Happy Anniversary. Our waiter was phenomenal. The food was amazing. I got the Thai coconut curry with chicken and the chicken was just awesome, and I don't usually love chicken. THEN, as if we weren't already impressed... FREE DESSERT! Overall just such a great experience.

Wandered over here on an unusually warm Saturday afternoon in hopes that the patio would be open (it was not lol). I've been here once before and wasn't super impressed, so I didn't anticipate leaving a 5 star review this time around.  

We had a stroller with us and they were able to accommodate anyway by seating us toward the back at a larger table. I wasn't planning on ordering an entrée, but when we sat down, I realized they were still serving brunch and couldn't resist...

I ordered a Bloody Mary and the Shrimp & Grits (prawns, chorizo, poached egg, jalapeño grits, black beans, and chile-lime butter). My entrée was delicious. The grits were so creamy that they almost looked like ricotta cheese. I also just love chile and lime flavors, so this dish was right up my alley. My friend ordered the Farmer's Salad, and was also blown away.

Our server, Jolene, was great--very helpful and friendly. She even wrote down the names of some locally brewed beers for our friends visiting from out of town.

I was stuck between 4 and 5 stars for this review because of my past experience here, but decided to give credit where credit is due. Also, upon discovering that The Gage is a Billy Lawless production, the fifth star seemed appropriate :)

We had a reservation for 10 people and we were  running 15 minutes late so we called to tell them. They said they had lost our reservation but had a table opening up for our party. When we arrived, they said that was not the case and said it would be a 2 hour wait. They weren't willing to work with us so we left.

Unbelievably good place. Lemon ricotta pancakes with strawberry and rhubarb compote and real maple syrup were a perfect blend of sweetness and tartness. The potatoes were satisfying. Service was flawless.
Great food and local craft beers!  I had the wedge salad with scallops.  The burger was awesome as well

We stopped in for a cocktail and a couple apps as we wanted to explore more of Downtown Chicago. The waiter did seem a little irritated we weren't a "high-dollar" table, but we ordered anyways. We ordered two seasonal cucumber cocktails-very refreshing, as well as the beer battered pickles (HUGE portion, great for a group of 4 or more), and some type of crab cake small plate- I can't remember what it was called, but it was delicious. The real winner of the night though was the house poutine- it reminded me of french onion soup. It was absolutely delicious. I would come back just for that. Only reason I knocked a star off- service was just alright, it was VERY loud, packed in, and dark. Couldn't have a conversation if we wanted to. But that being said, I would definitely stop by again and sit at the bar and just expect the loud environment.

Loved our dinner and restaurant's atmosphere. Our server was friendly, knowledgeable about specialties and right on time with everything. We enjoyed sitting in the back where it was a little quieter - the place was packed during holiday weekend. We will be back!

Bring an appetite! The summer dinner menu offers generous portions and across all courses, including dishes like Thai coconut curry to ribs to mussels. The average course option is around $20. Enjoy outdoor seating on Michigan Ave, right across from Millennium Park. Ambient candle lighting and deep oak wood make the indoor dining experience more intimate. Great spot for hosting out-of-town guests or coworkers after the work day.

The Gage is becoming a post-race tradition for me and the crew.  The shamrock shuffle was last Sunday and the Gage is near the finish line, so we came back.  Note that I didn't actually run this one, but I'm always up for brunch!

It was unfortunately cold on Sunday so I started with the Postalle Service (their take on hot apple cider).  It was beautiful as well as refreshing.  One of my friends had the Irish coffee and he said it was good.  The group shared the cinnamon sticky bun and I wondered how it could be worth the $6 price tag, but when Lindsay (our fantastic server) brought it out, I understood.  That thing was huge and delightful, though I can't imagine the sugar rush that would follow from eating the entire bun.  For my entree I had the chilaquiles and, well, yes.  Lindsay mentioned that the habanero salsa would be spicy -- it was not at all spicy for me, but I thought it was flavorful and the dish on the whole was delicious.  Many of the runners had the Irish breakfast and I'm told it was good.  

I still really like The Gage a lot but I reserve five stars for experiences that wow me and it didn't this time around.  But I'll be back for sure.

The food is great. The female bartender serving us was amazing, the one before her who had the man bun not so much. The thing that made it 2 stars was the bathrooms. I don't want to have a delicious 36 dollar dozen oysters and have a really nice server to walk downstairs into an out house. Their lack of care for the facilities does not match the aesthetics. I told the manager this concern exactly and monotone, and without emotion he parroted "thank you miss." It makes me worry about the kitchen if cleanliness is not addressed..

Yelp and others list the Gage as a "gastropub", but it is quite a bit higher end than (what I think) that. I mean, no gastropub I've been in has first, second, and third courses on the menu or a $75 (seventy five dollar) bone-in ribeye or a $999 (almost one thousand dollar) bottle of wine. That said, the place is great, the wait staff is awesome, attentive without being annoying and they choreographed the flatware changes, water refills and other amenities flawlessly. The venison burger and asparagus was very tasty, and the fried pickles app was larger than expected and delicious. I'd certainly recommend this establishment, but be warned it's no a $30 dinner place. Oh, lastly I got a Revolution Eugene Porter and, hallelujah!! It was served at about 55-60 degrees! Perfect!!

pics.caption: Eugene server at the exact correct temperature. Hallelujah!!
Venison burger, medium rare. Delicious!! Asparagus and fried pickles in the background

review.des: I come to Gage now and than for work. The food and service is always consistent/good. Chicken and orzo soup is very good. I would recommend for business setting as well as personal.

Service n location is great...

Food was good, the poutine fries were ok - the Ruben sandwich was also ok n the tastiest bite was probably the black lentil n chorizo soup special

Service was great.  My girlfriend and I decided to come here and have our parents meet for the first time.  Was a bit worried as the bar area and surrounding was pretty loud.  My father hears 50% on a good day.  I spoke with the hostess who made accommodations for us to be seated in a quieter area which was perfect.  Our server was awesome and his recommendations were on point. I tried the boar appetizer which I was delicious.  If you like pork give it a try you won't be disappointed.  I had the venison burger which was equally delicious. Bar selection was extensive and I guarantee you will find something you like.  Great place to treat your tastebuds without worrying you made a bad choice.
The evening went on with out issues and I think everyone very much enjoyed themselves.  I wouldn't hesitate to dine here again and encourage the selection.

The family went here for a late dinner dinner after a show.  Everyone was able to find something to their liking, which is difficult with two pescatarians and one strict carnivore.

First off their cocktail selection is really great.  I found a seasonal special call the "Field and Stream", Langley Gin, Amaro, Cranberry, Lime, Sage.  It was just outstanding!  Super unique and everyone at the table liked the flavors.  They had a very nice beer selection that our group took full advantage of.

My husband I split a roasted red beet salad that was delicious.  I had the fish and chips as my main.  They were great and reminded me of the kind we get when we are in London.  They were beer battered (not breaded and fried) and came out light and flavorful.  Couldn't finish mine so took it home and it made a lovely lunch for my husband.  The carnivore had one of the night's specials, a 14 oz rib eye.  He really enjoyed it and snarfed the entire steak.  It was served with two sauces, a Bearnaise sauce and a Poncho sauce.  According the son, you can skip the Bearnaise sauce and get double on the Poncho sauce.  He like it so much I think he would bath in it if he could.  Other dishes at the table were the Angolotti and the venison burger.  Both dishes were hits.

Honestly, there isn't anything that I would say was not good about our meal.  The only downside might be that it is a little pricey.  Great place though and we will definitely consider returning.

Great food, great burger "the special" burger, and great service. Came here to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and they made sure it was special and received nice desert! Would recommend to anyone looking for an intimate and great place for a date/group dinner.

I actually had a wonderful time at the Gage. Fish and chips is one of my favourite things whether it's at a dinky joint or a classier place like this, and I was not disappointed.

But I'm giving this establishment one star as I overheard an employee (who I later found out was a manager named Brandon I think) mocking an Asian customer's accent. Completely unacceptable, and I will not be returning here nor recommending this place until I know that classless racist is gone.

Went here with a friend on Sunday for lunch (brunch) and it was a pretty good experience.  

There was no wait and the service was great.  A guy brought us water, before our waitress came to take our drink order, almost before we could take off our coat to sit down.  

Friend and I both ordered our meals and both arrived quickly and were good and hot.  Great quality and taste from us both.  Also, prices a little high some say, but for the amount of food and quality, it is well worth it.  

Also worth noting that the inside atmosphere was great and definitely want to come back for dinner and drinks.  Looks like it would be a lot of fun.

Great spot for a business lunch or dinner if you are in the area. Personally, I am never in the loop area aside from work hours and I think it's safe to say most Chicagoans follow suit. With that being said, The Gage is a perfect business lunch or dinner spot as one will notice when walking in you see mostly businessmen or women filling up the place. The Gage is the real deal though and they certainly have weekdays on lockdown.

If a friend or business client wants to grab lunch during work hours and I want to impress...The Gage is my #1 spot. Food is excellent and they do have a great drink menu (for dinner that is..ha).

Lobster Roll - can't go wrong with this. Well executed with plenty of lobster. You won't be disappointed.

Smoked Salmon BLT - Very tasty but I wished the bread would fit around the salmon as there were bites of bread lacking salmon.

House Poutine - Probably one of the best poutines I have ever had. I've had poutine in Toronto and Montreal and yet I find this is my favorite. It's delicious and the one thing is that their poutine isn't too heavy. The gravy isn't too thick so you're able to eat more of the dish.

Overall I love this place. The prices are higher but you're dining in the loop area where higher prices are to be expected. Thankfully though their fare lives up to the pricing.  

#RefereEats
"I call it like I eat it."

Sorry Gage, if it wasn't for my wife intervening with vigour it would be 2 stars.

Friendly enough staff, but the food wasn't anything special and in fact distinctly average and somewhat greasy.

An awful table by the door on New Year's Eve sealed the deal, if I was writing this unhindered it would be 2 stars because I didn't enjoy it, my wife however has eaten here on several trips to Chicago and assures me it was an 'off' night, sadly I'll not know what an 'on' night looks like as I won't be back.

pics.caption: Lobster roll and fries, average at best.
Highlight of a distinctly average meal. Scotch egg.

review.des:
Attended 12-05-2016.
Friendly upbeat atmosphere, Staff is positive and energetic (Benjamin-our Waiter, thorough & professional). They were ready for us as we arrived (and we were early due to the CSO). There were 6 of us. Recommended some cocktails and were well received. Appetizers and their signature Scotch Egg, House Poutine, Loaded Shishito Peppers 's were just the ticket. Our wine was a France selection, 2012 Chorey~Les~Beaune, Veilles Vignes, Michel Gay Et Fils, Pinot like, balanced & full bodied. Perfect for our diverse selections. Various meals ordered: Roasted Pekin Duck with White Bean Cassoulet was well enjoyed. The Spicy Buffalo Ribs with a Balsamic BBQ Sauce, as a main course, was worth the order. The Roasted Amish Chicken with Buttermilk Mashed Potatoes (for our health conscious guest), was fresh tasting & moist. Their Regular Burger with Chips required a doggy bag to be enjoyed another day (and she did). Their signature "Gage Venison Burger" with Chips, 2 orders, was a continuous gastronome experience with every bite (One was saved also for another day). The Chef is without a doubt, a true culinary master. On a scale of one to five and five being the best, I give our experience at the Gage a "Five "(They should be impressed, since I do not grade on a curve and am a perfectionist). Returning again. The Gage, highly recommended, Bon Appetit!

I went here with my coworker while in town for work. It was pretty happening for a Monday night. It sits right across from Michigan park and has indoor and outdoor seating. The waitress was nice. Okay let's talk about the food. We ordered the Asian BBQ ribs they are everything!!!! You should definitely try them. For my entree I had a grilled pork chop with peach mustard sauce and grilled peaches with chili corn grits. It was well prepared my only grievance is I felt for $38 plate I would get a larger chop with less fat. I can't say I tasted the chili in the grits  I guess I was expecting a lil lick ur nonetheless it was yummy. The friend had a chicken plate she said it was good. Overall I give this place the thumbs up.

pics.caption: Grilled pork chips with Peaches and chili grits

review.des: A really cool location with low lighting. A little pricey. Great French Toast. Friendly service. This is a great place to go if you want to have a special brunch experience. The ambience is definitely hipster, trendy, intimate, and classy.

I first tried their Scotch egg at Lollapalooza in 2012 and I've been wanting to come here ever since. I'm disappointed that I waited so long for a completely unsatisfying meal. The husband and I ventured into the city to go to the Planetarium and we stopped here for lunch before heading there. I was starving, but wanted something not so heavy because we were going to be walking around for awhile and didn't want anything that would make me feel lethargic. I ordered the scallop "salad" which comes with fried shallots, cucumbers, and a grapefruit and orange medley. What I got was a serving of fried shallots that was overly abundant and enough lettuce for 7-8 bites with a huge pile of fried shallots left. I was given about 6 quarter sized scallops that were delicious but I am still STARVING. I don't think it can be considered a meal with the little amount of lettuce I received. Maybe it was meant to be an appetizer and not an entree, but when I ordered that as my entree, it would have been nice if I was warned about the size. My husband had the soup and sandwich combo with the broccoli soup and the Cuban. Neither impressive and neither would be something I come back for. Service was great, but I wouldn't come back here again.

*addition*
We had dessert, the banana bread pudding and it was meh. My husband thought it was just okay and I had 2 bites and was done. I only had a 2nd bite because I wanted to give the dish another chance. It was salty and bitter and just gross. To top it off, I went to the bathroom after and the stall I chose, didn't have toilet paper. There were TWO giant TP dispensers in the stall I was in and both were empty. My original review just went from 2 stars, to 1.....0 if that was possible.

pics.caption: Scallop salad which is hardly any food. Mostly fried onions and very little lettuce. #starved

review.des: Had dinner here while vacationing, and it was excellent.  I'm impressed that they're able to fit so many people in there.  Even so, the atmosphere and service were great, and it didn't feel overcrowded.  The menu was diverse and had something for everyone.  The food was delicious.  We stopped in a couple more times for drinks throughout the week.  Again, service was top notch and we felt very well taken care of.  I'd be a regular here if I lived closer.

The Gage is one of my "go to" favorites when we are in the area. There is thought and purpose behind the menu while keeping things modern and approachable.

They have great cocktails and the staff is the epitome of professional.

So, I made a reservation here on a Tuesday at 5pm. I'm glad I did not just walk in because it was busy. It's loud when busy, but not so loud that you have to yell at anyone to get them to hear you.

So, we were seated and our server came over and introduced himself. We looked at the menus and I got a little confused by how it was set up. Firsts, seconds, thirds...seemed like a lot of food. The server explained to us about how that worked and that a lot of those could be shared. He asked what were thinking about and if we were going to have wine or cocktails. We usually have wine with dinner, so he suggested wines for what we were eating. So, we ordered a bottle of the Numanthia Tempranillo. It wasn't too dry because I don't like my reds to be very dry. We ordered the house poutine as our first. It had good flavor and is good for sharing with 2 people.

My friend ordered lamb shanks with roasted brussel sprouts. I ordered the roasted Pekin duck breast with roasted turnips and radishes. Our food came out fairly quickly and the lamb was very nice (I got a bite) as were the brussel sprouts. I will definitely have to order the brussel sprouts if I go back before the menu changes. My duck breast was good, I especially liked the crispy skin. It came on a bed of white bean cassoulet with shredded duck mixed in. The turnips and radishes were not flavorful enough for me, but they were roasted well.

We shared the Honey Crisp Apple Crumble for dessert. That was pretty tasty and not overly sweet.

We had a nice dinner and I would definitely come back here.

pics.caption: Lamb shanks, brussel sprouts next to them (background), and my turnips and radishes in the foreground.

review.des:
My husband and I came to the Gage prior to a matinee showing of Phantom of the Opera.  I had been here before for a drink and loved the ambiance, but this was the first time for brunch and I am rating this as a brunch experience.  I think that we would have had a different food experience if we went there for the carbs and wanted the cinnamon buns, but I think a restaurant should be able to cater a quality experience for any item on the menu.  If I were to rate this restaurant solely as a spot for drinks, I would be giving this place a 5 out of 5.

Service - excellent, attentive, good recommendations

Food (below expectations)
- Chicken and Orzo soup - my husband got this and I found myself wishing that I had also ordered it - it was very homey and tasty - 4 stars but this is not really a traditional brunch item
- Irish Breakfast - the homemade sausage was not good, it was under-seasoned, not cooked to a good crisp exterior, and the interior texture was not pleasing - 2 stars - I do not recommend

Drinks (excellent)
- Strangers on a train - excellent if you like citrus cocktails, which I do.  The St.germain adds such great flavor - 5 stars
- Red medicine - good flavor if you like scotch.  My husband is the expert here and he enjoyed

This is a terrific restaurant!  We had a Friday night dinner there in November, and it was hopping with a stylish, nicely dressed crowd. The place itself is a hybrid of old and new styles. The noise level is on the high side of moderate.

We started with cocktails. The old fashioned is maybe the best one I've had anywhere. We then shared the deviled salmon and the beet salad, both of which were wonderful. The salmon was perfectly seasoned and attractively presented in a glass jar with garlicky, thick toast. Yum. The beet salad was nicely dressed and had some crunchy element that really elevated it above the usual.

We then shared the duck, comprising both sliced and perfectly cooked slices of breast, and a confit leg. So good, especially with the risotto underneath. We also had a side of perfectly cooked and seasoned Brussels sprouts with blue cheese.

For dessert, we shared pumpkin spice doughnuts with maple sauce. It was not overly sweet and utterly delicious. The espresso was excellent, as well.

Our server, Mike D,, was pleasant, knew the menu cold, and took really great care of us. I will happily return when back in Chicago!
Tough place to dine alone, but met some friends. The Scotch Egg was my first time and was amazing.  Great beer selection and their old fashion looks amazing.

Great place to enjoy a late lunch after the Cubs celebration in Grant Park. Six of us all agreed the food was pretty good and as downtown prices go, fairly reasonable.

I ordered the fish and chips - it was done perfectly. Large pieces of fish with a light, slightly crunchy breading that hit the spot. Fries and slaw that accompanied were equally good. Busy place - we were seated a little late for our 3PM reservation, but it was reasonable. Restaurants have no exact way of knowing when guests will leave and they can't be forced to go.

I definitely plan to return and sample the vintage Pimm's Cup they had; on evodka and the other brandy based I believe.

As many times I've been here I've never been disappointed - this time was no exception. From an attentive waiter and very friendly front of the house staff to an amazing meal I'll keep returning.

I've had pretty much everything on the menu but come back time and time again to the mussels (done in a tomato sauce - do yourself a favor and ask for extra bread) and the cheeseburger (perfectly seasoned and cooked). This time my friends and I went for the daily sundae - chocolate hazelnut. Didn't come close to finishing it but worth every bite!

pics.caption: Chocolate hazelnut sundae-- big enough to share!!

review.des: Great food Bd good ambiance !! Some of my vegetarian friends did not have options , other than that would recommend this place anytime
Great place!!  way to do it right! Friendly and super fun to hang out ! Will be back to try again!
Best old fashioned I have ever tried.  Delicious fish and chips.  Definitely would go back - dropped in late night after Blues Feat and was not disappointed.

Flew in from New York for 4 days and we Came in for breakfast and didn't see the brunch menu so my girlfriend and I were a bit disappointed, we looked forward to some eggs benedict and blue pancakes we saw on thwir brunch menu, so we started off with some of the specials the server recited , they were just extraordinary, we had the sweet corn bisque which can be done wrong but it had blackened scallops chunks inside best part is we didn't even ask to split the soup or entrees and they were already brought out to share , the beet salad with scallops were just to die for , scallops were cooked perfect, then on the entrees we went for the half roast chicken over chick peas and the special red snapper over horseradiah puree it was just perfect haven't had food like this in quite some time or since I was in culinary school haha definitely need to cone back

Great experience, i ordered their fish special which was delicious.  We also ordered their shishito peppers and got 1 in every 3 to be spicy!  i was loving it; but my friend wasn't!

I couldn't remember if i had been here before.  It felt like my first visit and so it must be; and i'm shocked living so close to by i hadn't been here more.  

Wine selection was amazing; and the staff was very friendly and knowledgeable with their menu.  Sometimes being pescaterian i get picky with ingredients and tend to ask million questions.  I really appreciated their service!
Slow service and long wait after reservation time with group of 12. Food was okay. It was $100 for my fiancé and me to eat lunch with 2 drinks each. Not good for a group.

We walked in here by accident while looking for a wine bar, so I will start by saying that they have the most abysmal wine list I have ever encountered. However, they get four stars for excellent and attentive service at the bar, the delicious mussels and brownie crunch bar. It was a great way to kill 45mins before my dinner reservation elsewhere.

I came here after the cubs game on a Saturday because the dive I was counting on was closed and so was everything else near my hotel. The crowd was 'Staten Island Trash' to a T(Sorry Chicago, I don't know where your bro's and John Ralfeo's live)  but the staff was very friendly. I decided to get the venison burger and it was  absolutely fantastic. The flavors all worked well, the portions were good and the price was right.

I stuck around for a few martini's and chatted with the bartenders. They were all really cool and saved the night for me.
Update - I can't find a martini glass in Chicago I like so I'll have to pack my own. Not just the Gage's :).  Didn't realize I was as finicky as I was about my martinis.
This place is beautiful, convenient location from visiting the Institute of Art. It was busy, but our dining experience felt private. The lobster roll was magical. The service was great too.

Loved everything about this restaurant: the ambiance, the food, and the service. We had "The Regular" burger and the fish and chips, both of which were perfectly done and delicious. Our server, Nadia, was engaging and knowledgeable. She suggested the beer that would best go with our meals. Great experience all around!

Outdoor seating and good food and service. The chicken in both our Caesar salad and soup was very generous and tasty. Excellent place to kick back and enjoy the honking horns and sirens going by constantly. Fast service and enjoyable setting. Stop in if on Michigan Ave.

We went there for a sunny spring brunch because the menu looked interesting, and the location was just right. Inside was quite noisy, so we asked to be seated outside. There is just something about spring in the city on a busy street that just sets the mood!
Mimosa and Bloody Caesar were both delicious, and we had to have seconds. We wanted to order half of the menu, but decided to start with the New England Lobster Roll and the Gage Venison Burger. The lobster roll was delicious, but the burger was truly to die for and cooked to a perfect medium rare!
Portion sizes were much bigger than we expected, so we were glad that we did not order more food. This experience left us wanting to return on our next visit to the city and to try out more items on the menu.

Cozy close to Christmas, the place was festooned with classy garland & lights. Tidy service at the packed bar. Beautiful beer & cocktail menu. The pork packed poutine was decadent & inspired. Seafood stew was perfect on a cold Chicago night & the burger was picture perfect medium rare with the kind of fries that make me weep with joy. The only miss was the pumpkin spice cocktail, but it's hardly worth mentioning. We loved this place, wholeheartedly.

Wonderful spot with a good Chicago Pub (loud) vibe. The front desk hostesses can stand a bit more personality and to be reminded that they're not doing God's work, but otherwise a lively watery hole with great food (pricy but good) you can lose yourself in for the night. Street parking is tough and best for one to use the underground garage or a car service.
The gage is the bomb.com. Service is always above and beyond and food is far above average bar good. The staff is so friendly and accommodating and it's my favorite bar in the loop.
Nice location in the city, great filet mignon and some nice wine. The service is very friendly

Dropped by for a late lunch on a Sunday. Their mussels are awesome! Probably the best thing on their menu. We also tried their fish and chips, which were great as well. Everything we ordered was great but what really made our meal were the mussels. Must have. It's a relaxed atmosphere despite it's upscale appearance so it's a great place for a midday drink and meal.

Visited the Gage for a girls night out with my friend Elen. It was our cheat day so we could eat anything. We each started with the Farmer's salad and for our main we choose the roasted amish chicken which we combined with house fries. We felt like we can also get a dessert, although by that time we were already full. Anyway, we ordered mint chocolate coupe with nice Italian wine - perfect ending. We really enjoyed our time at the Gage. Food was delicious, quality service and great atmosphere.

Overpriced version of Dearborn but with worse for and drinks. I'd say, avoid restaurants on Michigan Ave.

It's packed on a Saturday night but easy to find seats at the bar. The bartender is nice but eager to recommend the most expensive items on the menu, didn't seem genuine at all.

For drinks, we got the Black Manhattan, Strangers on the Train and the Red Medicine. All tasted pretty standard and on the sweeter side, they are a bit stingy on the liquor.

For food, we had the steak salad and the lamb shank. For the steak, I asked for medium but got medium rare:( The lamb is probably the only good item we had there, very tender but was pricy, the dish costed 40 bucks.

Oh, and this place is VERY touristy.

Overall, not a huge fan and won't come back.

Here's the thing and I keep saying this over and over to all restaurants. When calling your take on a classic dish DO NOT use the classic dish title!!!! Eggs Benedict consists of a twisted English muffin cut in half.  Two pieces of Canadian bacon, Hollandaise sauce and maybe a sprinkle of paprika. What I had at the Gage,although good. Was NOT eggs Benedict and should not be listed as such on their menu. Call it something else but not eggs Benedict!

Nice atmosphere and we were seated in the back which was much quieter as the front was packed and super noisy. Had pretty good fish and chips (salty for me) and a beer. My friends both had the chicken but felt it wasn't quite up to the $26 price. Service was good.

I came here late-night with a group of colleagues after a long day of meetings and receptions. They were able to seat a group of 6 immediately, which was a plus.

For the table we ordered the burrata and their award-winning poutine. I can see why they've won awards. It's super porky with shreds of braised pork and rich gravy. It was unbelievably addictive, but be warned the portion is very large so make sure you have at least 4 people to share it with, otherwise you will have major regrets because you'll either eat it all (likely) or have to waste some because leftover poutine is hideous. The burrata was good, pretty standard.

I couldn't resist the venison burger, so I ordered that medium-rare and swapped the fries for a side of the charred green beans (no problem, love it when places are flexible). Amazingly, the green beans were the fan favourite of the table - I forced everyone to try some because they were ridiculously good. Charred, spicy, with a punch of cured pork from the guanciale, and a hit of citrus from preserved lemon. They were really exceptional. My burger was also really good, but the temp was more medium than medium rare. However, it was juicy and well-seasoned with great toppings. I think I ate it all? It's a big burger, almost comically-so when you're going in for your first bite. I felt like a python trying to swallow a deer.

Everyone else was all-around satisfied with their meals, with a slight hiccup where a rockfish actually arrived as salmon, but the server was very apologetic and offered a replacement (not necessary, it was still delicious). Others got the elk rack, filet, and pork chops.

Of course, everyone wanted to split the check evenly when I had only had a burger and no alcohol while everyone else knocked back cocktails and 12 oz steaks. Seriously, guys? I'm not paying $100 for a burger. Pffft.

Super impressed!
We've had tomato soup to start with and ended up with crab Louis + short rib sandwiches.
Liked all of them

Great food! Walking distance of the Private Bank theater, so if you're looking for a place to eat before a show there, would recommend!

Ambiance: Came on a Wednesday around 6/6:30pm and it was packed! So if you were looking to catch up with someone I would say this wouldn't be a good place to do that as it will be difficult to hear one another. Pub feel with tables for first come first serve by the bar area and a sit down area that you can make reservations for (I'd recommend). We didn't have a reservation and luckily were able to get seated right away by the bar. The high tops share the booth area and have bar stools as well, but you get pretty cozy and intimate with the tables next to you. Even when you don't intentionally try to listen in on the conversation next to you, you hear it anyway, that's how close you are.

Food: We both got the Rose and shared the Amish Chicken and Oysters to start. The Rose was very refreshing and in a decently sized glass. The oysters were in a broth/sauce that was very flavorful. It almost had an Indian/middle eastern type flavor. Perfect for dipping with the bread that accompanies it. The chicken was big enough to share between two people, it wasn't too dry or too moist. For two glasses of wine, a main dish and app to share, we paid $50 a person with tip. Not bad.

Service: Was great, our server was attentive as can be with how incredibly busy they were.

Would definitely be back to try some other things such as the Venison burger.
Our all time favorite brunch spot in the city. The bloody mary is by far  the best. The food is delicious and we have yet to have a better burger anywhere else.

I appreciate a thoughtful menu with generous and relevant details. If you have organic, grass-fed meats, THAT, dear restaurateur, is something that is well worth boasting about on your menu. Tell me about it! Don't make me raise an eyebrow at your servers in disbelief. Bottom line, I don't mind spending more on quality grass-fed, humanely raised meats and organic foods but I'm not convinced that this is the place to do so.

At The Gage, I didn't find much boasting over quality ingredients but I did find some savvy marketing on the menu. A roasted "Amish" chicken that has nothing to do with Amish or organic or even free-range farming? *eyebrow up* Thanks but no thanks. Grass-fed meats (according to our server although it was not written on the menu) from the butcher board? Sure...*eyebrow up* I'll take your word for it. I'm hungry and I have a train to catch.

Service was excellent. After asking so many questions about menu items, I had the nerve to ask our friendly server if it would take long. What a good sport. Our meals came out reasonably quickly and our server was both attentive and knowlegable. Easy 5 stars for service.

The food, however, wasn't as impressive as the service. There wasn't anything spectacular about the asparagus with poached egg. It's a rather large side and there is plenty to share between 2 people. It included a mix of green and white asparagus. The asparagus was well cooked, though maybe a tadpole (oops, foreshadowing), I mean a tad too much for my liking.

Now, about that egg...I love tails on puppy dogs and piglets but I don't love tails on poached eggs. And yet, there it was. A poached egg with a long tail. A big, fat tadpole on my asparagus. I'm thinking ungrateful thoughts about this damn polliwog and I'm suddenly reminded that I walked past a hungry man with a dying cat on the sidewalk. Am I selfish to want them to be the way my mother made poached eggs: always perfectly cooked in little round egg cups with compact whites and runny yolks? Never a runny white, especially not one with a stringy tail! Oh, Gage, why can't you treat that egg with the respect it deserves instead of cooking it into a baby frog costume? Why did you put a 2 star egg on my 3 star asparagus?

Anyway, the Colorado lamb chops were medium rare and deliciously seasoned. I was extremely grateful to see these perfectly cooked with a red center. Brah. Vo! They came with a Merguez sausage that was flavorful but dry and underwhelming. The mustard greens were perfectly cooked and well seasoned, and the garbanzo bean fritters were crisp and tasty. Overall, probably close to 4 stars.

My hubby's 8 oz bone-in prime filet steak was delicious although it wasn't the medium rare requested. It was more of a medium-well to well done. Well seasoned, but I really missed seeing that red center. I didn't even see pink. Also, this was a butcher board item. Again, although nothing on the menu indicated it, our server told us that this was grass-fed *eyebrow up*. At $38 for 8 oz, it should at least be perfectly cooked to order even if it ate cement for dinner.

The Caesar salad was generously sized and very tasty. I could have eaten this alone for my meal, especially after experiencing the polliwog. The anchovies were just as salty as an anchovy should be and the dressing was perfectly tangy. Delicious. High 4 stars.

Overall, probably close to 4 stars. There is plenty of room for improvement in the food, at least in several of the items we ordered. Service and ambiance however, were both easy 5 stars.

pics.caption: Colorado lamb and merguez sausage with chickpea fritters, sautéed pea tendrils, blackberry and mustard green salad

review.des:
I was in Chicago on business and was told I had to try The Gage. We popped in for lunch on a rainy Saturday and waited 20 minutes for a table of two. Totally reasonable in my experience, but you should make a reservation if you're worried about time.

Our server was very nice and attentive. We ordered the fried pickles, fish and chips, and the roasted Brussels sprout soup. Despite the crowd, our food arrived quickly and cooked to perfection.

The fried pickles were crispy and hot. The fish portion of the fish and chips was honestly the best I've had - crunchy outside and flaky inside without feeling like it's drowning in oil. The Brussels sprout soup was warm and a welcome break from the fried food.

If you're in the area, give it a try!

Long story short, everything was fantastic except for the ill tempered server named George.

We had reservations on a Saturday night for 9 pm but were seated a little later than that. The manager came out with glasses of prosecco on the house which was much appreciated. We ordered the scotch egg and poutine to share and I had the bison burger with a side of green beans.

Scotch Egg: 3.5/5 I didn't know what to expect but it tasted like a egg wrapped in breakfast sausage deep fried. The mustard that came with it had a nice kick but the egg itself, I could probably pass on.

Poutine: 5/5 holy mother of jesus where have you been all of my life. The perfect french fries were topped with shredded pork shoulder, melted cheese and this delicious gravy. This dish probably shortened my life expectancy a couple of years but totally worth it. However, the pork shoulder somehow migrated to the bottom of the dish before we discovered the treasure trove of protein.

Bison Burger: 3.5/5 It was juicy and a perfect medium rare but not all that flavorful. Maybe my palette has been off lately. It was good but not fantastic. Perhaps it was overhyped and I was expecting more.

Green beans: 3.75/5 They were delicious and topped with bacon but it was too salty. The green beans were delicious and flavorful and the bacon added another delightful touch but the salt content was too much. If less salt was added, 5/5 for sure.

Service: 0/5 where do I even begin, George was rude and brusque and couldn't be bothered to help us. So sorry we're an inconvenience but hey I did see you break that bottle and glass of red wine all over that man's dinner jacket. I was sad when he took away our last scoop of poutine without asking because our entrees were ready. He was never there when we needed him and hovered when we were trying to figure out the bill. Thanks for nothing George! The guy clearing the table and refilling the water cups however, he was awesome. George just sucked.

I definitely look forward to coming back, I know my dinner companion has come back 2 times in the week after we went there. I just don't want to be seated in George's section. Ever. I'd rather starve.

pics.caption: Venison burger with a side of green beans ($4 surcharge)

review.des: Great service. Fantastic drinks. Food was good. Had the pork Shoulder poutine, fish and spicy chicken sandwich - all were really good. Poutine on appy menu is a meal!

Beautiful space, good service, yummy breakfast cocktails. Sticky bun and fried pickles are delicious! The BLT sandwich for brunch is good but way too big to eat with your hands. I had to cut it up and eat it piece by piece.

Wish it wasn't always so busy! The Scotch Egg is still the best I've had in the states. Food and drinks are always spot on. I love sitting at the bar and enjoying a great convo with the bartenders and drinking an Old Fashion or Bloody Mary.
Delicious lunch!  Atmosphere was great and the sweet corn dessert recommended by our server was incredible!

Amazing food with interesting touches. Came here twice in 4 days, never had a just average dish. Barratta, beet salad, burger and poutine all excellent. For a fine dining place the portions are surprisingly generous.

pics.caption: Beet salad with a nice kick

review.des: Food was amazing, service was awesome. I'd go here for my next brunch in Chicago. I'd recommend Eggs Benedict! :)
Excellent food, even better service.  Try the Scottish egg and Venison Burger!  To die for!

Great great space for dinner, drinks with friends, or both.

// LOCATION // Perfect location across the street from Millennium Park

// SERVICE // Excellent. The servers are prompt and sweet without being overly pushy. You can nurse your drink all night and no one will bother you.

// FOOD //
    + Fish and chips: They were so sweet to split our dish without even asking. The fish was crunchy without being overly oily
    + Old Fashioned: Perfectly proportioned and finished off with a nice large ice cube
    + Moscow Mule: Complete with copper cup!  
    + Moscato wine: Fruity and sweet

* Avoid the junky food carts in the park, and skip over here instead for quality food and drinks

If you're seeing a show at the The Chicago Theater, this is a great spot to grab dinner beforehand. Front bar area is loud and crowded so be sure to make a reservation for the less chaotic back dining area. Service is fast and food is solid.

We had the Fish and Chips and the Thai Coconut Curry. Not exactly a cohesive menu but both dishes were really good. Fish and chips were crispy on the outside with tender fish on the inside. Came with ketchup, tasty tartar sauce, and a small coleslaw side.

Atmosphere is refined but not uptight. Seating in the dining room area is comfortable and cozy. Great restaurant for the area.

I've lived next to The Gage for what seems like an eternity but never made it in because it's food was a little bit on the hipster-ish side and my boyfriend has an extremely picky palate (SIGH).

We were tasked with taking a client out to lunch and I decided to hit up The Gage somewhat on a whim. I had no idea if it was going to be appropriate for a business lunch, if it was going to be too rowdy from the Millenium Park overflow, or if it was going to be dead. I must say that the inside of the restaurant surprised me at how classy and expansive it was! It had a great vibe that everyone in our group enjoyed.

We had a party of 4 and were seated immediately in a booth near the back. I was tempted to try the Venison burger, but opted for Grilled Hanger Steak. The food came out promptly and the steak was cooked perfectly. It was served on charred romaine and topped with a flavorful buttermilk dressing. I never have been a huge fan of romaine but ended up devouring all of it.
My only minor complaint about the meal was that the dish was a bit on the oilier side and was heavy on the salt.

Service was prompt and accommodating. No complaints there! Definitely a good spot to take a date, or a client!

Lousy, clueless server, Which is unusual for the Gage. We waited nearly 15 minutes for him to appear; actually he might never have except we flagged down a busser and asked for him. When he showed up, he didn't apologize for ignoring us, or act welcoming, just said "what can I get you?" Not very personable or friendly (until toward the end, when it was tip time;) he checked on us once the whole time we were there, which was a long time because the service was so slow. I got the eggs benadict, which would have been great except it seems to have sat under the heat lamp long enough to cook the eggs through, and I could have used more jalapeno hollandaise (which was very nice) but we never saw the waiter for me to ask him. The breakfast potatoes were good too, but the cheese had congealed, again presumably from sitting too long. We were there over 2 hours, for freaking BREAKFAST; missed the pre-performance talk we wanted to go to. It was bizarre; he would literally visit every other one of his tables in the room and ignore us; I practually had to yell at him to get the check because he was walking out of the room AGAIN (3rd time in a row) without checking on us, after he was at the table RIGHT NEXT TO US. Didn't ask us if we wanted anything else, coffee, etc. Just dropped the check.
Also, the sticky roll was tasty but not particuarly fresh, kind of stales on the outside. Disappointing visit; hadn't been in a couple years, may not rush back thanks for this doofus. Too bad.

The best! With my food allergy and sensitivities, there's only a handful of things I can eat. And I manage at The Gage. The staff takes care to go through long lists of ingredients to keep me safe. "Thank you!" Tonight, Sean (the manager) made what was already a fine meal into a perfect one to suit my taste/needs (beyond what I had asked for). "Another big thank you!" Wholesome, delicious, homemade food...a delightful culinary experience every time!

Best burgers in town!! I personally think they are WAY better than Au Cheval. I order from the Gage just about every two weeks. The quality and service is always consistent. I also enjoy their fish & chips and fried pickles!

Great food and location. We were there for a party Friday night, and the accommodations downstairs were perfect. Great staff and food was wonderful. We came back for brunch the next day, and it was  very good!

A friend and I sat at the bar here for late dinner and fancy cocktails on a Friday night. A bartender immediately came over to greet us and we asked him for recommendations on cocktails. He spent time inquiring as to what we each liked and disliked and was really knowledgeable and easy to talk to.

I ended up trying the hand-shaken strawberry daiquiri and my friend got the habanero margarita. Both were fantastic...you can tell this place puts thought into their signature cocktails and they really know what they're doing. For food we split a venison burger and PBR battered fried pickles. The burger was excellent...super juicy and topped with gouda and mushrooms. The fried pickles were also super and the portion was generous.

While the food and drinks definitely stood out here, the service from our bartender might have been the real highlight. Despite being busy on a Friday night, he took time to chat with us about not only our drink and food preferences but also our trip to Chicago and more. This was definitely one of my favorite spots on our trip.

Really great lunch with our two teenagers and our server Scott was excellent.  Hubby and I split the venison burger and it was plenty of food. Son got the regular burger and daughter had the fish and chips. Great location- highly recommend clean bathrooms too!
Rock solid upscale place for foodies. Wine was excellent. Romantic setting where great conversation flows.

Located right on millennium park, gage is a busy gastropub offering everything from burgers to steak to tuna tartar.  

I've been here twice, and tried several menu items, and you really cannot go wrong.  The venison burger is delicious, not like typical venison and the menu only gets better from there.  

I tried the tuna tartare, and it was fresh with delicious homemade crackers.  The beet salad is also out of this world, and has homemade croutons and a delicious dressing.  

My manhattans were delicious, though I am told that the old fashioned is their signature drink.  

The management and staff do a great job handling groups of all types and sizes and are friendly and attentive.  Service, drinks, and food quality is all around excellent.  

Overall this is a great place for any dinner, whether going for business, or for a steak or just to grab a quick drink.  I would recommend gage to anyone, you won't be disappointed.  

Make a reservation if you can, because the place gets crowded.

Great service at the bar and amazing food. I had the venison burger with fries and it was probably the best venison burger I've ever had. I'd definitely recommend trying it out. It's a little on the pricier side, but it's worth it. Jack was my bartender both nights and he was fantastic. If you're looking for live music to see, he's your man. He's also a great conversationalist.

Good brunch option in the loop if you are doing the touristy stuff: museums, bean, etc. Usually there isn't a wait, and the prices aren't outrageous either. Got some benedict thing, and it was actually pretty good. Also would recommend for work events or if you have family in town.

With a location across from Millennium Park, in a part of Chicago dominated by fast-casual chains catering to tourists on weekends and busy corporate types during the week, a restaurant like The Gage does not need to be much better than mediocre. But The Gage aims higher: the restaurant is lovely, bustling, and wood-paneled; the menu spans from crowd-pleasing (burgers, fish and chips) to trendy (burrata with fig and mustard, artisinal sausages, fried pickles) to stodgy (oysters and ribeye). Though they aim higher, the result is exactly what the place needs to be: good but not great.

We came for drinks and appetizers. Our server was a little too chatty: she spent about five minutes going over the entire menu when all we wanted were some fried pickles and cocktails. When we ordered, she told us that we should order more food. I guess she wasn't thrilled with the fact that, on a busy day, we were only getting a drink and a nosh when other tables were dropping Benjamins on steaks and wine. So I understand why she would be disappointed, and she was generally a good sport about this situation, which I appreciate.

The food is not as stellar as it aspires to be. The burrata was tasty, but the fig was a little weak and the mustard even more so. The dish needed more acid or sweetness. The fried pickles were decent, but I don't care much for deep fried food (or pickles, really...this wasn't my order). My old fashioned was serviceable. I appreciate the large ice cube they use (which is pretty as well as functional: less surface area means less melting means less dilution).

The clientele is sort of a hilarious mix of baseball-capped tourists coming from the park, well-dressed business folk, and slick yuppies. And I mean that in the least judgmental way possible.

The place is pricey, which is justifiable given how hard the place tries and its location, but I'd rather go get some cheaper eats elsewhere if push came to shove.

I can now get over the trauma of one of my last visits when the kitchen ran out of lobster rolls when I had my heart set on it!

At this brunch outing, 4/6 of us ordered the lobster roll, as we were reminded to try the Gage's version after a recent Chicago lobster roll article we saw. At $23 for the entree, the size of the portion surpassed my expectations, but the execution on the roll fell short.  

Rather than serve as the star of the dish, the lobster was hidden, both physically (hidden under a bed of onion strings) and by the chives, celery, and other mix-ins.  Chips were the side to the lobster roll, and you get a heaping serving.  I would have preferred more lobster... and present in meaty chunks at that vs. the shredded kind of form.  Seems like the Gage really made out on the margin on this dish.

Solid place for brunch. I recommend making a reservation to avoid the usual 30 minute wait. Cinnamon roll is outstanding. Literally pastry perfection. Gumbo was good. Chillaquilles nice and spicy. Scotch egg perfectly cooked. Corned need has awesome too. The far back room near kitchen gets warm so maybe fine up front. Friendly efficient service.

pics.caption: Just order it. Thank me later.

review.des: We came in on father's day for dinner. We had a reservation and were seated promptly. Our server was quick to come take our drink order and reccomend one of the specials. Drinks came pretty quick. We ordered the cheese board and our entrees. The food came out very quickly and things went down hill from there. The server forgot to put in the cheeseboard and apologized. Said he would buy us dessert to make up for his mistake. (I'll add he never wrote down our orders but memorized it..) the food was good. I ordered the filet Mignon which was undercooked and underseasoned. My husband got the reccomended rib special and it was excellent. We had to flag the guy down to order another drink which took a good 10 mins to arrive. After dinner we requested the dessert menu and I ordered a cappuccino. The server never brought the menu, i had to ask the bus boy/food runner who brought my coffee which also took atleast 10 mins to arrive. 20 mins later our server never returned. In the end we didn't get dessert because we were sick of waiting. I wanted to drink my coffee while i ate dessert but we never even got a chance to order it. Our server did have a few tables but there were large portions of time that we never saw him. As we left he was in the front of the restaurant chatting with other servers. Food good, service friendly but very lacking.

Vibrant atmosphere and great service.
Food was above average but not exceptional
Drinks were good too.
Definitely great restaurant to hang out slightly away from busy downtown.

O.M.G

This place is absolutely outstanding.

Food is amazing, service is outstanding and the whole place is just out of this world good.

We had the Poutine, Scotch Eggs (how good these are is not a joke), and the sausage (bangers and chorizo)... not a single complaint to be had which for me is unusual.

Burgers, and corned beef hash we're really good but what really stands out is the quality of the fish and chips. Crisp batter and flaky white fish without the greasy film you get in so many places... just outstandingly good fish and chips... OUTSTANDINGLY GOOD!!!

If you're in Chicago, do yourself a favor and come here to eat, you will not be disappointed.

This place is great!!!
We came here on Saturday for late lunch and there was no wait! (what a surprise!) The waiter was very knowledgeable and super friendly! He was giving us nice suggestions and samples of beers to try. We ordered the Scotch eggs, mussels (both were very good. You need to ask more bread for the sauce of mussels. yum!). The gage burger was decent. we also got the chef special with the steak and lot of stuffs in. we also like the atmosphere here!
Been here many times for drinks or dinner and every time it was been solid - food top notch, atmosphere conducive to talking and relaxing, and service efficient.

You think in order to have juicy tender flavorful meat, u need good quality meat of course and excellent marble on em. This place had completely changed the way I view meat and became a believer than lean meat can be just as juicy and flavorful. Had their elk rib rack meat and its the cleanest "beefiest" meat I have ever eaten. Thank you GAGE!

pics.caption: Elk rib rack.. The best meat that rivals ribeye, porter house, new york strip etc

review.des: I had been here before with my coworkers, but tonight I had a a date here. The place was packed and full of life. We were quickly seated with a reservation. Our waiter was very patient with us and made some really great suggestions. My date liked seafood so he had 1/2 order of mussels, oysters, and a salmon dish. I had a salad and the pork chop...which as you can see was HUGE and absolutely delicious!! We ordered drinks and he even ordered some deserts. I think our bill was like $200, but worth every penny for the experience and of course the date. Definitely will be coming back...especially if we have an anniversary...lol

This is a great place . I was solo mid evening and ate and drank eat the bar. The bartenders were especially friendly and their Service and advice on the food  was incredible. Also I was flanked by locals that were also very nice and made the experience all the more enjoyable. Excellent food, drinks and hospitality.

I'd go 3.5 stars. The service was prompt, but generic. Props to Benjamin, he made sure we had everything we needed throughout the experience. The food was good, some of it was a bit bland. The cheese board was excellent, as was the special chocolate truffle cake (restaurant week). The potato purée on the short rib was somewhat under seasoned, and the white beans with the duck could have definitely been cooked a little longer.

Overall, we had a good time, the vibe was rather romantic, but there was a vide variation in the people dining: couples, friends, small parties and large, but it's not super high on my recommend list for people first visiting Chicago. It's not stuffy or pretentious at all, which is a major plus. I'll have to visit again for the bar, the cheese curds seemed to be flying out the kitchen.

pics.caption: Short rib (restaurant week) and the Peckin duck with cassoulet.

review.des: Amazing setting, very friendly and very informative waiter. Two of us ordered the Amish chicken with brussel sprouts, while the other order venison Burger...higly recommend. Beer and wine selections perfect.  Cannot wait to go back.

My friend was craving fish and chips so we decided to swing by and have a *proper* meal before heading out to the ballgame.

We were surprised, from the outside we didn't expect it to be a full-on sit down dinner type of place. I was pleasantly surprised though, as the decor/architecture takes you back to another era and we were treated to some of the best service we received in Chicago.

I'm jealous of the burrata because it photographs way better than I could ever hope to!! Not to mention it was absolutely creamy and delicious. They are generous with the bread and gave both my friend and I our own plates of toasted baguette to use as vehicles for that buttery cheese.

Seeing as it was a sit down dinner I couldn't help myself and ordered the roasted duck breast (nevermind that my friend had fish and chips and here I am horking down half a duck). The duck leg was cooked confit and fell off the bone. The breast was also nicely done and had a good crisp on the skin. My only complaint was that the risotto was a bit underdone. The manager came by and playfully scolded me for not eating what he dubbed his favorite dish on the menu. I felt put on the spot and didn't have the heart to tell him that I didn't want to eat crunchy risotto!!! :( Really everything else about our meal was excellent and I would go back again if in the area.
