pics.caption: Duck breast AND duck Condit over risotto
The burrata looks as good as it tastes.

review.des:
Daytime bartender: 5-stars. Great personality, best service, and a nice guy.  

Had the "regular burger" rare with fries and a side order of Tabasco sauce.  The swiss cheese on the burger was really "melty" (can't think of the appropriate word), and it added to the great taste of the burger.  Fries were good, but even better when soaking in hot sauce.

The food is delightful and so flavorful- food came hot and well prepared- server -misha- was very attentive and offered great suggestions. The oysters are delicious. Ribs and fish and chips both flavorful and filling! The chocolate cremee brûlée was a perfect ending!

I went here at 10pm on a weeknight after having one too many at a bar, and was extremely pleased with the quality of the food. Service was unotable, but we didn't drink and didn't get involved ordered, so there wasn't much that could have been different.

Shishito pepper appetizer - so, so, so yummy.  Crunchy breadcrumbs, creamy salty aioli (but not too much), plenty of peppers (thank you for not skimping) perfectly charred.  Don't be scared of the chicharron.  

Venison burger - freaking delicious.  Salty, spicy, crunchy, spicy, melty, gooey, not gamey at all.  I am craving it.  I rate it over the au cheval burger hands down.  Fries were good, not as good as 5 guys (this could start a whole debate, I'm aware) - they were a little too oily.

Tasted my companion's sausage and kraut - tender sausage (none of those nasty grisly bits) and well balanced...but I ordered better.

Well done, I'll go back.

Friendly service and great food options. The green beans were fantastic - bacon and garlic infused. I had the heirloom Apple salad and it was really good. Everything I have had here has been delicious .

They have a beautiful beer list and so start it with a pint of wheat beer.

Started the meal with their scotch egg. Although the wrap had a fantastic flavors truly reminiscent of a scotch egg from the UK -  it has to be you know that cat fully hard boiled over cooked egg inside of the beautiful wrath is still a fully over cooked hard boiled egg (unlike any scotch egg you would have in the UK of course)

I followed the meal with their routine which was advertised as being as traditional to the original puts in from Quebec as possible south of the border. Dare I was not disappointed and any potential fan would probably not be disappointed at either. - The sauce was not quite right with the cheese the fries and the pork altogether came perfect - as good of a poutine as I have had in the US.

Finished the meal with the venison burger. - The looks definitely did not disappoint!!  The taste did not disappoint either the mixture of mayo mustard onion mushrooms and peppers mixed with the venison patty were very well pronounced and the delicious simply!

Came here for our Monthiversary Dinner. My boyfriend first found this place because I was craving for mussels and plus it's always nice to try  new restaurant. As soon as we got to the Gage, we realized we came here for St Patrick's day awhile back lol

Since reservation was hard to get, our dinner started close to 9pm. And subsequently, we ordered a bit too much cuz our hungry stomachs overruling our logical minds. We had 3 appetizers (mussels, scotch eggs and fries/pork belly thingy). We also had ribs and grilled seafood as our main entrees. I dont usually eat ribs but thanks to house of cards...I've been craving for ribs because of frank underwood lol. And yes the ribs were delicious :))))

The gage is also a nice spot to throw events and to grab a quick drink or two. We saw a pre-wedding reception in the basement and it looks really nice.

Oh. My. Gosh.

If I lived in town, this would be my brunch spot for sure.  I ordered the eggs benedict dish and finished the entire thing.  If this place managed to have mimosas for less than $11 each, I would love it even more.  But I sufficed for just a glass of champagne by itself (which oddly was less expensive than a mimosa).   I attempted to take a picture of my dish but ate it before I remembered because it was so delicious (sorry).

Everything on this menu was impressive and it was highly recommended to me by a local.  I was not disappointed.  This place was PACKED on the Saturday morning I went, so if you are looking for a quiet, low key place, it may not be for you, however it was a GREAT spot for families and groups.  

I would recommend mimosa specials here, but next time I am in town I am for sure coming back here.

Great spot to bring visitors to Chicago with it being right on Michigan Avenue and across the street from the bean/Grant Park.  The Venison burger has been one of my favorite burgers in Chicago for probably around 5 years now.  Awesome beer selection and cool ambiance.

Venison burger was amazing. This was the second stop of the night, and I shared the burger with another person. They knew we were going to share it and brought out two plates, half burger each, with fries/pickles for both of us. Incredibly surprised by that and very glad they they took care of us like that.

Someone mentioned it was my birthday and they brought out a complimentary brulee. Top class place right here. We had 7 to our party and had to split up, but we didn't really care. It's pricey but I'd come back for the burger!

Excellent location near grant park. Good service and amazing old fashions. The decor and ambiance is quite chill, Romantic even. But the food to me was just nothing amazing. The elk is good but not memorable. We also got the venison burger which was just average. Good restaurant for sure but I don't think I tasted anything that wowed me, which unfortunately is characteristic of my Chicago trip thus far.

We stumbled upon the Gage last year by accident just to take a late night dessert break. The chocolate cake we had was remarkable! So we returned this year to give it another dessert break. Unfortunately, they no longer offered the cake. No problem. We ordered the Strawberry Creampuff. Wow!  It was light and sweet with homemade strawberry ice cream inside!  Coupled with a white wine it was the perfect afternoon delight.

Was in Chicago for the weekend and decided to try The Gage for one last lunch before we head back to south Florida..

The food was fantastic and the service was even better. We had Trent as our server and he was courteous, professional and had a great personality.

I would highly recommend this place to anyone who either visit Chicago were just so happens to live in this beautiful city.

If you do go on a Sunday for brunch, I highly recommend the corn beef and hash! It was to die for.

Great experience.

A solid stop prior to going to the theater.    We had Wes as a server and he was attentive and knowledgeable.   Test on his beer and wine IQ and you will be impressed.   We had the poutin for an app and it was huge and tasty.  It was almost a meal unto itself.  Fish and chips were decent but the burgers were solid.  The place gets a bit noisy but that's part of the charm.   Service kept it at 5 stars.

It was a rainy evening in Chicago..., no it really is. The food is very good, the mgmt is pretentious and the atmosphere is as well.

The food is good/ Caesar salad was very good- fish and chips were average- the peanut butter cake was really nice/ but you can do better in this town.

I ate here because it was highly recommended on yelp, but I tend to disagree.

Some much better offerings in the Gold Coast area- so do your homework and find something worth your time and money.

And if they're full, you can sit at the bar and not worry about booking a reservation through open table. I shudder to think if I had tried to use an opentable voucher how well that might have gone.

One last comment, the closeness of the tables is a bit uncomfortable- so if you like eavesdropping on others conversations, then this is your kinda place.

Bon APETIT

I have been here quite a few times, which means it's review time. I love the Gage. The service is always friendly, prompt and engaging. Drinks are well made and the food tasty. If you don't try anything else, get the fried pbr pickles. These are a must.
Great bar for drinks and also has a really awesome brunch. Fun atmosphere, great spot in the heart if the city. Would recommend the eggs Benedict and the cinnamon bun for breakfast!!

The Gage was a delicious experience. Bestie and I went on Thursday after an event downtown. The ambiance. The service. The food. Becky, our waitress, was friendly and knowledgable and fun. Her and the manager both played along with I said how much I "hated" my food even though my plate was clean :). We started the meal with fried pickles and the peppers. Loved the pickles and liked the peppers...had some spice. I had the chicken which was seasoned beautifully with Moroccan spices with cauliflower steak, Swiss chard and cauliflower purée.  Bestie had the salmon..she loved it. I finished the meal with a scoop of chocolate ice cream and and she finished with a lemon tart. Overall an enjoyable experience and I will be back.

Pre-theatre dinner, solid and fast service - we enjoyed being seated near the kitchen, it was like being in the room where it happens!  NY strip was perfectly cooked, buttermilk mashed potatoes were a hit, roasted Brussels sprouts were excellent, and charred green beans were thoroughly enjoyed.  My kids enjoyed the roasted elk rack, chicken tenders, and mac/cheese (the best they've eaten...).

I love the idea of the gage, but every time I go I'm only partially satisfied. I recently went and ordered the fried pickles and eggs Benedict. Pickles were great and the eggs Benny were okay, but I wasn't a huge fan of the pork or potatoes. I really wish they had a standard eggs Benny! Drinks are awesome though! This was the first place I learned about pisco and now I drink it all the time. Service was excellent and very attentive, which I really appreciate! My mom loved the scotch egg, which had a hard boiled egg inside and my dad enjoyed the Lobster roll.

Went here as our last meal in Chicago...

Exceeded all expectations!!! Get the ribs without hesitation! Get the bison burger without hesitation! Get the "regular" burger without hesitation! Get the old fashion without hesitation!  Thank me later. :)

Left BEYOND FULL!!!! Thank you for giving us our best meal while we were in town!
I enjoyed The Gage. Cocktails were spot on.  I enjoyed the Black Manhattan. The Black Manhattan was smooth and balanced.  Our order of Oysters was fresh.

Highly recommend. Sit at the bar! They know how to make super classic cocktails. Very good. I also recommend trying any of the cocktails off their menu.
Food: I had the fish and chips. Amazing. Guinness battered fish and nice crispy chips. Comes with three dipping sauces, couldn't ask for more!
Check it out, you won't be disappointed!

Changing menus!  That's what makes this gastropub a must go every time you return here!  Beer selections with gourmet bar food that is seasonal.  What a great way to change it up, otherwise, it will get a bit boring coming here.

You must get their Poutine!  Their Poutine was delightfully delicious!  It was with cider braised pork shoulder, chopped pickled red onion, with chunks of Wisconsin cheese curds, jalepenos and poured over roasted pork gravy!  YUM!

Per the bartender's recommendation, do get their Daisy Cutter Pale Ale.  It complimented well with the Poutine!

The ambiance is chill and it will be swell to have company to dine with here so you can try more of their other gastropub entrees.

I was enGAGEed indeed!

Delicious.  I travel for work and this is waaayyyyy better than anything you will find in the downtown area.  Downtown is congested with mediocre steakhouses and chain restaurants.  Go to The Gage.  It's a no brainer.
Omg delicious! The fried pickles and fish and chips are a must! The lavender soda and a bubble rose both made there are light and refreshing. Service and ambiance great. Will be back for the desserts

Sides: shishito peppers, market veggies (frissee, evoo, onion, butternut,  parsnips,  pepitas, pickled raisins, green onion)

Peppers were smoky and rich with so much flavor. Would definitely order again and recommend. Market veggies were delicious and perfect compliment to all the interesting and crazy flavors. They definitely held their own in flavor and freshness. Good balancer.

Fish & Chips: Super fresh, good portioning. Would definitely order again. Not the star of the meal.

Venison Burger: Mouth-watering good. Moist and so much flavor in every single bite.

Bread Pudding: TO-DIE-FOR. So rich and creamy yet dense and just the perfect amount of texture. And not too sweet which is unusual for us and bread pudding. We were hesitant but the waitress said it was her go to and their holiday seasonal offering.

Ambiance:
Hip. Loud. Young.

Service:
Excellent.

Overall:
Might be one of Mo & I's favorite meals overall. Great experience.

I meant to make it to The Gage for lunch as I knew that their dinner menu was a bit out of my price range, but unfortunately dinner it was. I was greeted by a hostess but decided to sit at the bar; she immediately followed with a menu, which was nice. I ordered their G.T.O. drink (Gin, Bonal Aperitif, Grapefruit, Lime, Thyme), which was amazing. I'm a bit picky about gin drinks since I was lured in and disgusted by a gin-and-cucumber mix at the downtown Chicago Tilted Kilt, but this mix was perfect.

For food I tried the Burrata & Watermelon, which consists of Burrata cheese and slices of watermelon and cucumber doused in an amazing yellow tomato vinaigrette. There's also brioche on the side and some mint to top it all off, and the whole thing was delicious. My only thought was that they maybe could have used a slightly stronger-tasting cheese.

Overall, service was friendly and timely - they were great about filling my water and asking me if I needed anything else. I still want to have the chance to visit The Gage for lunch!

Being from Los Angeles traveling to Chi-town only for a short weekend, you could imagine how nervous we were searching for a restaurant we'd hope wouldn't leave us disappointed. However, I am so happy to report that The Gage was an AMAZING choice! The ambiance was so warm and the smiling faces and excellence service was a dream! Chicago is really a city for the people.

The food was delicious and everything from the hot apps to the entrees were very enjoyable! The fish and chips were seasoned to perfection, the fried pickles were crispy and addicting, and the potato soup was one of the best I've ever had! But can we talk about the lobster roll! Oh goodness! Most lobster sandwiches your lucky to get a couple chunks of meat. But The Gage's Lobster Roll really is a force to be reckoned with! No fillers over here! Lobster, lobster, lobster all the way around! And the price for it made it twice as good!

From start to finish, our time at The Gage will always be a highlight of my trip to Chicago!

pics.caption: Amazing bar shot as you enter!

review.des: When in Chicago this is seriously the best place. Waiting staff is fast and efficient. Managers are lovely. You can't beat this place. Burgers are unbelievable. Just go here.

This place ain't so bad! I was expecting this place to be a bit of a tourist trap, but it was actually very good. The have a small but interesting beer menu, and some very tasty snacks. If you're in Millennium Park and in need of a snack or drink nearby, I'd be happy to recommend this place.

We had fried pickles and rinsed them down with a very good Sazerac and their AMAZING Black Manhattan, made with their special Fernet Dogma!

We had an incredible meal here last week. The crab avocado toast and chocolate mousse were delicious. The staff especially the manager were so courteous and friendly. He really made the night special. I love the ambience and being to look out on to Michigan Ave.

Brilliant Brilliant Brilliant

The gage , a fine dining Michelin star restaurant located in the heart of Chicago ...
It's know for inventive American food!!
Loved the lavender cola, figs with Brie & pine nuts, scallops on a bed of risotto and halibut with mushroom , asparagus and topped with vinegrette.
The best part was the rich chocolate cake topped with peanut butter cream cheese and served with cookie crumble & mascarpone!
I really enjoy coming to this place. Excellent service and phenomenal food. Nice choice of wines and great atmosphere. I'm really looking forward to coming back here.

Boyfriend took me to Chicago for my birthday, smart boy that he is, researched where to eat. This was dinner, and now Boyfriend has sealed his love for me. First of all, what an ambiance! Is fancy pub a thing? We didn't feel under dressed in our jeans, but would have fit in just as well in dressier gear. Having arrived early, we grabbed a drink at the bar. The bartenders were very busy with the after-work crowd, that didn't stop them from checking in with us plenty. Both of us ordered whiskey cocktails, both drinks were fantastic as well as beautiful. We tipsily made our way to the hostess to be seated (I got distracted by how pretty her hair was, because I'm a weirdo).

Our server was an absolute delight. She also gave honest answers to our food questions, which I always appreciate. I ordered the venison burger (I never eat red meat, but was feeling adventurous), Boyfriend got the elk (everyone was feeling adventurous apparently). Everybody shut up and eat here. My burger didn't weird me out at all, was crazy delicious, I ate so much I couldn't think straight. Boyfriend was more than pleased with his, I even tried a bite and it was great! He sneaky told them it was my birthday, so we were brought a great piece of cake. I managed to fit some in my dessert compartment stomach despite being way too full.

The options here are not standard, but you will love them if you're feeling up for something unusual.

After a visit to the Art Institute a friend and I stopped into The Gage for a late lunch. The atmosphere was casual yet elegant at the same time. I liked that the menu was not too large which made it easier to order. We ordered the fried pickles with aioli and they were amazing! I had the Irish Breakfast which was delicious because of the different items on the plate. It included two eggs, bangers, half a tomato, a slice of pork and brown bread. It was amazing, presentation was great and everything was perfectly seasoned. The Mango Mule was super refreshing. Service was on point! Can't wait to go back!

Super cool, warm vibe inside. Total comfort-pub food with an extensive and varied beer list. It is on the pricey side, but it's a fun place for a celebration!

I had the agnolotti which was pretty good-- the tastes were there, tart and savory, but it was all pretty much the same texture, so if I were to go back I'd get something else. Maybe the fish and chips, or the lobster roll...

Came here on a Sunday with some friends for brunch. We got here around 2:00 and there was no wait which was great. They have a pretty versatile brunch/lunch menu with some classics as well as some more creative dishes, which is always a plus. I had a hard time choosing because everything sounded really good, but I decided to go with the Housemade Corned Beef Hash, which had two poached eggs and hollandaise on top. In general it was kind of a similar concept to a benedict especially with the hollandaise, but I really liked that since I was considering the pork belly benedict, and it's kind of the best of both worlds. Overall it was really tasty, not too heavy on the corned beef or the hash. And I actually liked that they used potatoes instead of hash browns because I'm more of a breakfast potato kind of girl.

I have to say the service was also really good. Can't remember our waitresses', name but she was really friendly without being too overbearing or pushy, which is always appreciated. I hear they have a great dinner here as well, but I would definitely recommend for a nice Sunday brunch!

pics.caption: A little dark, but here's the Housemade Corned Beef Hash! ($14)

review.des:
I've been here twice; once for drinks and once for dinner. Both times were good experiences. As soon as you walk in, the host team is very welcoming and friendly. The drink menu has a wide variety of choices as well. The atmosphere is classic yet trendy. Although it is very loud inside so I wouldn't recommend coming here on a first date if you intend to hear each other speak haha. There's also a nice fireplace in the back. For dinner my group of 6 only had to wait about 10 minutes to be seated without a reservation on a Friday night. Our server was very friendly, upbeat, and attentive. I had the Amish chicken for my main and it was really disappointing. The flavor was just strange and I ended up only eating a quarter of it. My friends also seemed underwhelmed with all of their dishes. The desserts were very nice though.

Overall I would recommend this place for desserts, drinks, and the great service. The food is definitely dismissable
Had a group of 6 and everyone loved their meals! Black bean burger was amazing! Service was good and we were able to sit right away.

Two times now after attempting to go to the Walnut Room, we eventually gave up due to the very long lines to eat, and b/c it's first come first serve to eat there. The last Walnut attempt one month ago, was after a 3 hour wait! And was so long, I took a walk with my dad to Harold Washington Library(is there a very common short acronym for this place, btw? there must be one by now, and it's 2016....), the last time we were stuck in that line a month ago. The Gage was our savior then, and it also was on an earlier trip here in late 2014. I've finally gotten to the point where I think it's my fav place to eat on this part of Michigan Ave., since Bennigan's(yep a chain, but don't care. was always my former usual choice in this area, if not going to Miller's or Exchequer) shut down across from Art Institute not many years ago.

Their beer selection is decent, and has a very decent amount of craft/micro beer choices. Yeah the beer prices might not be the cheapest, but you're on Michigan Ave. and it also isn't a dive bar, so what did you expect? For what the Gage is, I think they're actually reasonable, if a tiny smidge expensive by a buck occasionally. I tried a quick sip of a friend's cocktail last visit, and it was what I expected it'd be. Not bad if a tad sweet, and tasted about how I'd expect a cocktail to be like. It was fine, and I've had much worse cocktails too. Myself, I'm more of a beer person!

Food has been decent for the most part here. Extremely few misses, and most everything I've tried has been decent. Fish and chips are pretty good here when I sampled a bite, but not quite up to how much I loved the ones at the former Edgewater Lounge(RIP). But are better here than at Elephant and Castle, believe it or not! All the people I ate with my last time there enjoyed their food though, and I greatly enjoyed what I ordered on their weekend brunch menu(Baked Pumpkin French Toast). Someone else at my table I believe ordered a burger, and liked it.

Bet you didn't know(unless you've eaten here before, it's mentioned on their menu and website, and company ads are on the stairs going down to their bathroom and private party room), that the name came from Gage Brothers & Co., which in the early 20th Century was located in this very building and space. They were a company that at least supplied(dunno if they made any women's hats themselves, but I wonder if they did?) women's dress hats, throughout the country. Anyway, you won't be disappointed if you go here, it's casual, and a comfortable place to eat for anyone. My personal preference is to eat here over Miller's Pub, too.

Went here late at night for drinks. We requested to be seated outside. The service was prompt and efficient. I was excited to see a cider from Stem Cider, Denver, on their menu. The cocktail menu is good and priced like other places in town. On a warm summer night, it was a good place to wind down.

Went here for the first time yesterday for lunch. Really really enjoyed it. The food was great (especially the fries) and our server was super nice. Two people from our party had food allergies and she was really accommodating about it. Would definitely go back.

Seriously.. the most delicious Old Fashioned.
Drinks are pricey...sure....but made with intention.
I strolled in for happy hour and it was jam packed... although I quickly found a seat at the bar.
Cute little hipster bartenders...
fancy, masculine, industrial decor..
and seriously...
a YUMMY Old Fashioned.
I am a convert!

Cocktails and ambiance are reliably great. Some dishes are good, others just OK. Never really get blown away enough to come back more than once or twice a year though for dinner. If just for happy hour cocktails, this is a reliable go-to spot.

My boyfriend and I have been wanting to try the Gage for a very long time and finally got a 7:15 reservation on a Friday night.  First of all, the place is beautiful with glossy green subway tile and exposed brick. It was very busy and very loud, and although we arrived a little bit too early for our reservations, they were able to seat us within 10 minutes.    

Appetizers- we got the fondue and scallops.  We enjoyed both.  The fondue was steaming hot and the coconut curry-like sauce for the scallops was very good.

Entree- I got the daily pasta, which happened to be a kale and ricotta filled tortellini in vodka.  The pasta was super delicate and melt in your mouth but I did think the portion was a little too small.  My boyfriend got the duck, which he claimed was the BEST thing he had ever tasted in his life, so I highly recommend both.

Desert- We were really torn between which desert we wanted, but went with the strawberry shortcake that our waiter recommended.  The strawberry ice cream/ sherbet on top was fantastic- super tart and you could really taste the strawberries.  I didn't really care too much for the cake part which I thought was crumbly and a bit dry.

Least to say, it was a wonderful dining experience with a beautiful environment and plating. The Gage will definitely be the place to go when we have people come in to Chicago out of town.

Came here for the first time for dinner last week. This is a nice place and the service is very good. The only thing I did not care for was that the acoustics were terrible. It was so noisy it was hard to have a conversation without having to repeat yourself. There is also ouside seating which may be a better choice.

I agree with some of the other reviews here. The food is very good and definity above your average preparation. I had the lamb chops which were really very lean and a good portion as typically there is not much to a lamb chop. It came with a side of your choice so I had the roasted brussels sprouts with bacon and blue cheese. They were very different and excellent. I started with a beet salad which had a few differnet colors of beets and some star fruit in it. Again unique and very good. They also had some house made sodas which I tried all 3. One of them was a cola but it was clear. I never knew there was such a thing. Another was ginger beer with a pice of caramelized ginger floating in it which was a very unique taste. Overall I do not think you can go wrong here for a good meal.

Our group of 4 adults and 3 kids stumbled into the Gage while looking for a different spot, but no way could anyplace be better.
The service is second to none, coffees and waters were continually topped off and our every request was attended to immediately. But the food was the highlight. We ordered a mix of breakfast and lunch and each of us was sure we had the best meal at the table.
The cinnamon buns we started with were amazing, and the meals that followed were equally outstanding. The sausages and bacon were incredible as were the sauces and accouterments of every meal.
We will be back, maybe again for breakfast but we'd like to try dinner next time.
Also, the decor is very cool and every staff member we encountered was engaging and super helpful.

Amazing!!!!! Service...food...attention to detail.  This is what a great restaurant is all about.  We came in for brunch to celebrate our friends getting married.  We stopped by Cindy's first and had a horrible experience.  At The Gage from the moment someone answered the phone to us getting the check, service was impeccable.  They congratulated our friends, poured prosecco and bought us dessert. It's not the free food and drinks that matter, it's the professionalism of the staff that won us over.  Les was very attentive. Kevin stopped by several times and talked to us.  Food was also yummy.  My favorite dish was the potatoes.  Delicious!!!!!  Looking forward to another great meal at The Gage!

Came for a business lunch, really enjoyed the food and ambiance here.  For a party of 3, we sat in a quiet area of the restaurant so it wasn't too loud to talk.  Servers were very attentive and helpful.

I ordered the day boat scallops salad.  Very nice scallops with grilled octopus, as well as celery, shaved radish and carrots in the salad.  Loved the dressing and the onion Soubise sauce.  Very solid salad with nice seafood, vegetables and colors.  Highly recommend this salad and the restaurant.

We were recently in Chicago for a conference and found the Gage near our hotel. It was bustling and vibrant. We asked for a table for two and were told it would be a half hour. Well I've spent more than a half hour trying to figure out what to watch, so no biggie. However after about 40 minutes my tummy was growling and I could tell my wife was about to go full hangry. So I asked the manager at the front if their were any tables available in the bar and he said yes, that it was open seating. I was annoyed that I had waited for 40 minutes for a table to find out we could have been eating by this point and felt that this should have been verbalized as an option when we arrived. All that aside, we sat and had a nice experience from then on. Creative menu, nice service and a vibrant atmosphere describe this place. If anything it was loud inside from all of the imbibing patrons. Who can fault the place for that?  All in all, it was a good first impression of a cool city.

I was in town for a biz trip and came to the gage to have dinner with my coworkers. first, i liked the atmosphere. Second, i love their food! We tried a few appetizers and i also got hang steak salad. will definitely be back again :)

Go here. Just go. It's worth it. Our server was amazing.

We love wine, selections were great, perfect pours.

I also love whiskeys and bourbons. Their selection was really deep.

We had a cheese plate. Loved it. Had a dessert that may be in my top 5.

Overall this place is nothing short of a perfect place to go.

I love the service, the decor, and the ambience of this place! It feels like eating in an old theater, with all the classy details when I visited the restroom. I came here for a Sunday brunch. I'm out of town so I decided to order something I've always had and see how well they execute it - eggs benny. As a whole it was very delicious, poached eggs are on point, so are sweet grilled tomato slices and sausage (House made Pork Merguez). The hollandaise sauce (Poblano Hollandaise) wasn't the best I've had, since it's not a typical egg and butter cream sauce, this taste deviates from that traditional recipe and feels strange, a good way but not buy-able way; I can enjoy it but I won't order it again. It has a plant undertone with spice. The memorable part is definitely the baked potatoes (Gage potato), very yummy, starchy and well-flavored. This would easily be a place to enjoy quality time with family and friends or to impress with important relationships.

pics.caption: A closer look at the eggs benedict

review.des:
I can't get over this place. I'm obsessed.

I couldn't help but come here for brunch again, this time to try the Irish breakfast! We shared another scotch egg (still the best on the planet, I'm convinced). We both had the Irish breakfast which was delicious, but we probably could have shared it because it was HUGE. I passed on the blood sausage (eww), couldn't do that when I was in Ireland and still can't do it now. We also got a side of Gage potatoes, which were delicious.

It was restaurant week but we passed on the special menu. But the dessert on the restaurant week menu was Bailey's hot chocolate and cookies. We asked to get that a la carte. It was a little too sweet but very good.

I love The Gage! The environment is great and the staff is so friendly. Can't wait to go back again!

(Going to dream about that Scotch Egg now)

pics.caption: Best Scotch Egg in the wholeeeeee worllddddddd

review.des: This is a very well known restaurant in town. It is a modern American gastropub serving a variety of dishes from scotch egg to venison burgers. We ordered the scotch egg, the Spanish chorizo, the venison burger and the Spanish lobster roll. The scotch egg was a great choice for starters and it is enough for 2 to share. The Spanish chorizo has a mild taste but with lots of flavor. The venison burger was the highlight of our lunch. It was cooked to perfection. We are leaving the lobster roll for the end because we don't want to take you  away from experiencing this restaurant. The lobster roll was a big disappointment. I guess we expected more from a $30 roll. The roll was small full of sauce and with a few pieces of lobster. The sauce overwhelmed the flavor of the lobster. I wanted to forget the lobster roll so I ordered the cheesy biscuits but again was disappointed when they told us they were sold out ( brunch item sold out at 1:30pm ) We will definitely eat here again as everything else was delicious.

pics.caption: Cuban Lobster roll...average. Not worth it of the $$$ price.

review.des:
The restaurant offered an extensive selection of elegant food and the staff was very friendly

We really enjoyed the ambience too

Saw other people's review, decide to give a try when going to Chicago downtown. Wow, their service is the best ever! Everyone working there has smiles on their face and very friendly, feel very welcomed there and relaxed. Tried the mussels and their signature burger, great and great! Definitely going their again.

Great service, cocktails, and food. We really enjoyed the selection and lots of vegan options although not a straight up vegan place. Made it enjoyable and easy to eat with a wide range of eaters. Also recommend their house margarita!

Came here once years ago. Waitress wasn't that accommodating but food was decent. Glad we gave it another chance on our most recent visit, years later. Great brunch. Good drinks and bartenders. Came back late night for a cocktail and dessert after a show and manager was accommodating. Thank you. Definitely more than a safe choice on Michigan, close to the bean.
The best bar to have mimosas. Please ask for Dudie and he knows what we are looking for. Fell in love with the place

Had a late lunch today out on the sidewalk with my husband after spending the afternoon walking around The city. The menu looked perfect for a light late lunch. We both had the butter salad with blue cheese. It was delicious. We also ordered the fries with curry sauce - a ton of great fries with just so-so curry sauce.  The only reason we gave it 3 stars is due to the lack of service our waiter offered. He took our orders, delivered a drink while he was talking to another table, and never came back; the busboy brought out our lunch, refilled our water, brought us s&p, and cleared our plates. The waiter came back to drop off our bill. We watched him by-pass us every time he was close to our table. We actually contemplated tipping the busboy and not our server. Please train your server and promote your busboy!
Every time I eat here I tell myself to come back tomorrow. It's so stinking good. Always get the poutine. Definitely get the burger. Never get full. Keep eating. Explode from happiness. The end.

Outstanding lunch at The Gage today. Everyone from the hostess, to the bartender, server, and manager seems to have a genuine interest in serving delicious food and tasty cocktails with outstanding service. The place was hoppin' but no one seemed frantic or rushed. Looking forward to our next visit and more mussels!
Oh and also super friendly and accommodating to kids in the midst of a business type crowd.

I don't want the places I visited in Chicago to fade from my memory...however, I went to a ton of places in the four days I was out there. People from Chicago told me I've been to hoods they haven't been to.

So, I ran into a friend I hadn't seen in almost 9 years at the biggest museum ever. We were both 700+ miles away from home and just happen to be in the same wing of the museum.

He invited me to join him and his friend for drinks at The Gage.

I didn't have any food, but I liked the service and the decor.

Not the kind of place I would go to since I'm more into "brooklynish" type of spots with 1 $ sign, but it was aight!

Service was sociable and attentive. They let me make up a table for my party since I got there early. So I moved tables and chairs around at like a 5 star spot.

Very nice place.

It's unfortunate that The Gage had to follow our experience at The Aviary and the Truffle Explosion. We had a reservation for the three of us for a Wednesday night and when we got there, it was PACKED.  I guess that means we were in the right place! Having come off some boozy cocktails, we were definitely ready for food. We got right down to business when looking at the menu and went with the following:

Appetizer:
Fried Pickles: DELICIOUS. I loved the aioli sauce that came with it

Mains:
Trout Special
The Gage Venison Burger
Pasta Special + Chicken Quarter: After the waiter told us about the special semolina pasta that's made next door topped with an over easy egg, with the option of adding on chicken, I was sold. The chicken was cooked absolutely perfectly, with a little bit of crispy skin and juicy meat.  The egg and the pasta combo was equally delicious, and it turned into a fairly large dish.

Side: Shishito Peppers

Dessert: Corn and Blueberries: ABSOLUTELY DIVINE. I love cornbread and I love blueberries. This was a perfect combo that you wouldn't think to put together.  I'm so glad we did this, even if I was stuffed from my main (and on my way to getting drunk with the bottle of wine that was shared).

Our waiter was SO nice and indulged us in our touristy questions about what Chicago's like.  Obviously the pricing here is a little steep, but considering that we all ate what we ordered (and had a lot of the shishito peppers left over), I'd say that it was fairly comparable to what you might find in SF. Since Chicago's got a lot of great options for restaurants, I'd like to try other places before coming back here, otherwise it was a solid dinner option for us visitors.

Amazing burger, decent beer list.
Next time in Chicago will dine here again. Menu had some items that I want to return and try.

We split the BLT egg sandwich and jalapeno grits, which was more than enough for a filling lunch! Both were tasty, especially the grits!!

As for drinks, I had the G.T.O (pic attached). It was delicious-I love my gin cocktails!

pics.caption: GTO drink-love the smell of it :P

review.des: My husband enjoyed the rack of Elk and I had the duck.  Seriously one of the best meals I have had in a while.   Excellent service as well - professional, yet friendly.

I highly recommend the duck.  They have a very nice selection of wine, beer and cocktails.  our party of five was very happy with all their selections.  

They would have received five stars if not for the slow server to take orders and deliver drinks.  Once we ordered the food it came out quickly.  The place was jammed but well worth the experience.  

The next time I am in town I will drop by for dinner.

pics.caption: The duck was so good I needed to take a picture but I already devoured most of it.

review.des:
Amazing customer service.

5 star service.

5 star quality food.

5 star cocktails.

I for one like to go for it and order a bottle of wine.

We then always order the mussels, the sauce may change within season. When we were in last it seemed to be almost spicy and delicious. Extra gluten please so I can soak up the sauce.

My fiancé always gets the bone in rib eye with mashed potatoes.

I get the Ny strip a la Oscar.

I have yet to find a better steak.

Maybe I love that the hosts always know the occasion I'm in for, or maybe it's the waiter, my favorite THE GREEK. Always remembers us and has great recommendations.

Also the management that stops by the table and checks to make sure everything is ok.

By far one of my favorite restaurants in Chicago.

Thank you always for the phenomenal service.

See you soon friends.

I couldn't have had a better experience here. The food was exquisite, wine- yummy, and service great! Our server gave us complementary champagne at the end of our meals. I can't get over how amazing the food was and the sauces they make in house!
I went there during Chicago restaurant week for lunch. Very good location and service. The food is in ample portion. I especially like the lamb masala.

Despite the copious number of reviews on Yelp, The Gage feels like a quite underrated establishment in the Chicago food scene. It's a standard representation of the trendy-casual, American (New) fare that permeates Chicago. No, it's not as good as a Paul Kahan or Brendan Sodikoff representation, but The Gage should definitely get bonus points for its location. Housed in a historic building, The Gage gets my vote for best restaurant where you'll end up spending some coin in the Loop.

The menu is a little long but hits all the right, familiar notes. It doesn't stray too far from acquired tastes, as a venison burger or bison tartare is about as exotic as it gets. Thus, it makes sense to go the standard thoroughfare. My go-to is the fish and chips, which I like better than other Chicago luminaries like Parson's and Big & Little's. I also won't turn down the elevated poutine, even with the elevated price tag.

As expected, the draft list is very good here, with a healthy mix of seasonal craft brews. The Moody Tongue caramelized chocolate churro porter. Yes.
Mike D. guided my twin flame and I through a perfect meal. Dude knows his shit, is proud to work there, and it shows. Food n drink was top notch but not crazy pricey!

This restaurant was a last minute decision...they fit us in for a reservation and then even seated us early. The food was amazing, especially the poutine, buffalo ribs and the meat special of the night which was lamb. Our waiter, Misha, went above and beyond to give us suggestions from the menu and also suggestions of sights to see while in Chicago. Highly recommend this place!

Wow. The food here was absolutely delicious. We ordered mussels in a curry sauce as a starter, and I ordered the Roasted Amish Chicken. Someone else at my table ordered the Fish and Chips and I couldn't stop stealing food off his plate. Great experience, however the lighting was a little too dark for my liking.

Atmosphere: The place looks nice and classy. The reception was nice and the waiter is great. It might just be where I am seated, but the front of the restaurant is pretty loud and I could barely chat with my cousins across the table.

Food: The presentation of the food is very nice. It is very nicely done. The food also tasted wonderful. The Bison tartar was artfully placed, cylindrical shaped on the plate with the sauces placed just right to make the food look very appetizing. The taste was better than I thought the tartar would be. The tenderness came through and a bit of the gameiness added a touch of difference compared to beef tartar. For the entree,  I ordered a 'Meat of the day' entree and had the New Zealand lamb chops. The presentation is good and the taste to match it's appearance. The New Zealand lamb was very tender, juicy and had the fat content to give the lamb more flavor. Last but not least, the dessert. I had a Banana bread pudding as a dessert and it is wonderful. The hot bread pudding with a scoop of ice cream made a world of good eats. Absolutely loved the pudding.

Overall I would come back to this restaurant if given a chance.

pics.caption: Bison tartar that is so artfully plated
New Zealand lamb chops from 'Meat of the day'

review.des:
This place is just fab. It's right in front of the Bean -- excuse my touristy-ness -- so the location is great.

We walked in on a Friday night and it was quite packed. Although they were totally booked, they quickly and happily accommodated us in a "community" table that we shared with another small party. It actually worked out really well; we were very comfortable.

Now for the food -- I got the "regular" hamburger, but let me tell you, the name does not do it justice. This burger is not by any means regular. It is freaking delicious. It was cooked perfectly to my liking, juicy, fresh, and just amazing. Everyone in my party (5 of us) ordered burgers and there was a simultaneous "mmmmmm" as everyone took their first bite. We all kept raving about how delicious our burgers were.

I must admit that my fries were not fresh at first. The manager came over to check on us and I couldn't help but mention about the fries; he quickly brought us a huge batch of incredibly fresh, hot fries that were delicious.

Needless to say, service was incredible. Food was incredible. Vibe was incredible. A little pricey but most definitely worth it! Can't wait to come back on my next trip to Chicago.

The Gage has a limited menu and limited taste. But hats off to the soup of the day, potato leek with bacon! Best ever! I had the mushroom sandwich and the only thing I could taste were the mixed greens on it. I didn't finish it, giving the other half to my dining companion. The fries were okay, but for what they charge you would think there would be salt on them! We ordered dessert: I ordered the caramel creme brulee - but what I got was a chocolate brulee (?). My dining companion ordered the Italian Almond Butter cake which came with cherry kirsh and vanilla ice cream. She was smart enough to order the cherries and ice cream on the side - they could be a dessert by themselves. The cake by itself was excellent with their strong coffee and take the cherries and ice cream home with you. The atmosphere is beautiful and looks like a Chicago bar. But I think they need to go back to the flavor drawing board!
Multiple visits but only to the bar. Ask for Brendan as your bartender. Attentive and knowledgeable about the drinks.

The Gage is a terrific warm and cozy place on Michigan Ave that's perfect for the cold Chicago winters.  I had a lovely glass of wine and the fish and chips which was a huge amount of food and very well prepared.

Given its prime location along the park, this place doesn't have to be as good as it is to make money.  That's why it's special.

The food was excellent. Great location, and friendly staff. The only reason I'm not giving 5 stars is because our waiter was practically running away from us! We had multiple questions about the entrees- and he made it seem like we weren't worthy of his time. Started off with the oysters, which were probably some of the freshest and best I've had in the city. I got the duck breast with a side of the buttermilk mashed potatoes, the duck was cooked perfectly, and the mashed potatoes were wonderfully flavorful. We also got the lamb chops, which were the meat of the day, but those tasted a little over cooked to me. The fries were also decent, although I personally think they could have been seasoned better, they needed salt. Would have liked some bread or something before we ate, but this establishment doesn't do that. Good atmosphere, great place to eat while spending time on Michigan Avenue.
Amazing day - Outdoor cafe, amazing food, served by an excellent waiter, Zack. What more could you ask for?

Poutine was great and honestly we could've just gotten that and drinks and been good. They give you a ton of food. Buffalo chicken sandwich and smoked salmon blt were both great but we could only eat half they were so huge. I definitely recommend this place. Service is awesome too.

Decided to go on a whim and try The Gage, and I am so happy we did! The service was great. Paul was our server and he took such good care of us was super friendly. The food was delicious and came out super quick. Also-They have a great cocktail/beer list. We will definitely be back!

The place, the food, the service was absolutely outstanding! The venison burger was cooked to perfection! The soup of the day (potato, spinach with crab meat) gave me happy thoughts with each sip! Had the ginger beer and pumpkin layer cake to finish off the meal - DELICIOUS!! Can't wait to come back to this great spot near Millennium Park!

I was invited here to be schmoozed by a potential business partner and while he did not get my business, this restaurant will definitely be a go-to next time I'm in Chicago.

I've been on the hunt for amazing steak tartar since I moved out of France. I finally found it at the Gage. Seriously, if you can get over the fact that you're kind of eating raw meat, order this. Let your taste buds be adventurous, I promise that in this case, it will pay off.

I am by no means a vegetarian, but the Gage has a dish that almost converted me into a tree-huggin hippie (again.). They make this sweet corn pasta with grilled peaches and a butter sauce that made me see the light. It was by far one of the best pasta dishes that I have ever eaten (and I eat a lot of pasta.)

While a bit bougie and too trendy for my taste, dining at the Gage was overall a phenomenal experience. I left with my belly fully of happiness (but that could have been the alcohol.)  If you're looking to treat yourself (or a date) and you're in Chicago, I would head there immediately.

Everything about gage is amazing. The ambiance, the meat selections are impeccable, the cocktails are on point.... need I go on? If you are looking for a place that you can rely on to consistently deliver in all areas: food, service, and ambiance.
Excellent service. Very friendly bartender Les - helped us plan out our stay in Chicago. Food came out very fast, made from scratch. Delicious. Plenty of local beers in tap too.

I love the vibe and the service. The selection of food is good.

The food:
Bison Tartar - solid but not my favorite place in the loop for steak tartar.. It's mild in flavor and didn't come with an egg. I think it needed more mustard flavor or capers or something.

Burrata - fresh but not super memorable.

Fried pickles- very nice.

I would go back again for the vibe and the drinks since they are seasonal and the wine selection is solid.

We came here for my mom's birthday one year and we were not disappointed.  The reservations were easy to make or 5:30 p.m. on a weekday but the weekends are probably worse.  We were seated right away, even missing a member of our party, which is always appreciated.  

The menu is large and includes a lot of "American Classics" that are delicious.  My one friend swears by the poutine and you can order it for pick up and it's still good.  The cocktail menu is appealing, there's a full bar, and a decent beer list.  Alcohol prices are a bit high but I guess that's to be expected in the Loop.

I don't often find myself in this part of town, but The Gage is a good stop for tasty food that is decently priced for this area.  Gets busy during the summer and in evenings, so beware when planning your visit.
Great meal; located conveniently close to Millenium Park. Don't miss the pickles - they were our favorite part!
Fish n chips. Venison burger. Mojito. Yes yes yes. Definitely lived up to the hype. Came here for the weekend for my birthday and glad I stopped here.

What a great experience. The service was immaculate. The food is to die for. I had the corn beef hash and it was the best I've ever had. We also had the zucchini bread that was delicious. My cousin had the eggs Benedict and it was also delicious. Terrance great job. I highly recommend.

Really great place! Cool atmosphere and always a fan of somewhere that has reservations always makes me happy. I had the beet salad to start and it was a huge portion. My husband had the poutine as an app thinking it would be small and it was massive and super tasty! For mains I had the venison burger with green beans (these were great!) and hubs had the sausage and sauerkraut second. Both were fantastic but the firsts were such generous portions we couldn't finish it. This place has a solid beer list and generous wine pours (8 oz). All in all a great place and we'd go back!!

Came here for brunch on St. Patrick's Day, which was crazy! But we got a seat and enjoyed breakfast, some delicious Guinness and some fun Irish music.  Very glad we came here and would love to go back again someday.
Excellent food, service and overall ambiance. Our go-to dinner spot when we attend shows in the area. Not cheap, but quality. Mussels are great.

came here for lunch with some colleagues and i was content. i ordered the "crab sandwich" which i thought was a normal fried crab sandwich; nope it was a cold crab salad sandwich. i had to send it back, cold blue crab is a crime in itself. i switched over to the gumbo and it was very flavorful. the poutine however was way overcooked but the brussel sprouts were on point. i could possibly come back here but a lot of the food here is very heavy
The food was great and service prompt. Try the venison burger it is the perfect combination of flavour and spicy! you

Amazing food, but for a place like this, I was rather disappointed with the service-- the waitress was unfriendly and not very responsive to my questions about the menu. But for the food, I'll round up my 3.5 rating to a 4; here, the flavors of what are usually considered very typical, normal dishes are elevated to create absolutely delicious entrees.

Smoked salmon bagel: the garnishes here were what really made this entree delicious. The chives in the cream cheese added an extra dimension to the typical bagels + smoked salmon breakfast. The entree also came with a tomato and cucumber salad with some sort of vinaigrette; with just a hint of sour, the dressing almost seemed to elevate the freshness of the tomatoes and the cucumbers.

Potato, asparagus, and leek soup: Rich and creamy (but not excessively so), with just a tiny hint of lemon to prevent the richness from becoming overwhelming. The lobster was tender, and the croutons added a nice, crunchy texture. I can't say enough good things about this soup.

Overall, the food is amazing and what makes this place worth coming back to.

I had the best burger of my life here, so that alone is worth 5 stars. It's made with venison and comes with Smoked Gouda, Fried Jalapeños, Woodland Mushrooms, Pickled Onions, Mustard Aioli. The side of fries was also delicious - each one was perfectly crispy with the right amount of salt. They gave me a side of curry gravy for dipping, but the fries could stand on their own.Yum! I sent 2 of my coworkers there and they also raved about the venison burger.

This spot is quite busy (even when we showed up at 5pm), seating is "cozy" but service is lovely and I will definitely be back.
Went during brunch time food and service was awesome my husband and I will definitely be back!
Sat at the bar because there was a wait for a table. They were busy, the the bar staff provided great service. I ate the venison burger and it was excellent!!

We were Looking for a good place to eat on a Thursday night in Chicago and the bellman suggested The Gage. There was a nice crowd and a lively crew awaiting us. We were seated immediately and salivated as we decided on our choices for dinner. I chose the Fish Fry as it fit the budget I had set for myself for the evening. Had I not limited myself beforehand, I would have ordered the Duck. My friend ordered Buffalo Ribs and Mashed Potatoes. The Ribs were had a sweet sauce with a fiery kick to them. They had the right amount of bones for a decent meal. The Mashed Potatoes were about average.
The Fish Fry used Cod Fillets and was fried with a nice batter. In my experience the Fish was also average. The price was the best thing about it. Should I ever visit again, I would try The Lobster Roll.
Excellent menu and friendly staff that have real knowledge of the wines on the menu. The entrees are excellent as well as the desert choices.

If I were Irish this would be my hang out! Hold it, I am Irish, and when I'm in Chicago, it's my favorite place!
Oh yes, the Owner and patriarch of the clan Billy Lawless Sr. is in my top ten favorite and most respected people on the planet. Wish I could get there more, I have two children in college in Chicago, and a business, but demands on my time keep me from getting over to the Gage, and enjoying what Billy & his family have built. So do me a favor fill in for me until I can become less popular.

Dined here last night with my husband and his parents before the symphony. I'm not sure how it is that we were lucky enough to score a booth in the back of this restaurant, but due to the noise volume up in the front, this was a huge bonus as we could actually converse and hear each other!
Enjoyed the sausage starter which was not only beautifully plated, but delicious! The duck sausage was by far the best I have ever eaten. Side pairings were a perfect match.
We enjoyed four excellent entrees: the fish and chips, the pork chop with pistachio gremolata,
The Amish chicken, and a venison burger. We also shared the apple crisp with apple cider ice cream, and the pear and almond croustade, which was perfectly crispy, yet creamy. Served with honeycomb ice cream on the side-lovely presentation. Each dish was outstanding. Seasonings and vegetable pairings were spot on. If you are a lover of food, you need up check this place out. Great atmosphere for nearly every occasion, and guaranteed you'll be leaving with a full belly!

I had read some reviews and thought The Gage would be a fun place to get after game drinks and apps with my friends. We were not disappointed. The service was slow to begin with as a result of some miscommunication with the staff I believe, so we asked a passing server if he could let our server know we wanted to order. It was after about 15 minutes of no service. He offered to take our order and so we gave it, thanked him, and continued having a pleasant time taking in the cool decor, and low hub of the restaurant. Our drinks came out promptly and to our surprise the manager said they were on the house! We weren't especially upset or anything, so this was a nice suprise. First off, the food is gorgeous! As well as thoughtfully prepared. We ordered a ceasar salad and poutine to share, my husband also got the soup of the day. The ceasar was beautiful, with just enough dressing to crunch down on the romaine without it dripping all over. They also had a succulent little anchovy lying atop the salad, and it was so fleshy and fresh it was actually my favorite part. I  happy I cut it up so I could savor it. Onto the poutine. Yum!!! Curds a plenty and delicious slow cooked pork and onions with a savory gravy over crispy French fries. I ordered a strawberry pie for dessert, and the restaurant also have us a pretty little cookie plate to share as a token for their mistep earlier. It was so nice and we really appreciated it, especially because it was completely unnecessary.  Looking at the menu, this would be a great dinner spot, but I am glad we got a little taste of what the Gage has to offer.

pics.caption: Strawberry pie with Chantilly cream. Delicious!
Shared ceasar salad. This is a half portion and it was perfect!

review.des:
My night was almost ruined after having watered down, ratchet Old Fashioneds at a work party. I know better than to ask for fancy drinks in those types of situations, but the bartenders had bitters and mixers so I can't help myself!

Coworkers and I came here to mingle more afterward and you bet I ordered an Old Fashioned! This was was strong and perfectly concocted. Somone in the group ordered a bunch of apps and told us to try some. Trying the fried pickles was my second mistake of the night because I couldn't stop putting them in my mouth! Thanks to the coworker who bought them, but sorry for devouring most of it!

The drink was so strong that I accidentally dipped fries in a cup of creamy tomato soup. Whoops! I mean it was 9:30pm and kind of an odd time for soup, plus no one was eating it....

This place was super packed on a Thursday night, but that could have been due to numerous places having holiday after parties. The menu looks amazing so I need to come here for dinner soon! I'll order my own bowl of pickles this time. :)

Came here with a friend on a Sunday labor day weekend during peak dinner hours. Despite the influx of labor day tourists, the place was busy but not packed.

The menu is filled with typical American dishes from $$ to $$$$ prices: burgers, steaks, fish, etc. We asked the waiter for recommendations and he told us the fish & chips and venison burger were the restaurant favorites. I went for the fish & chips; my friend the venison burger.

While I don't have anything negative to say about my meal, for $19 dollars before tip and tax i feel like they charge too much for what is a pretty standard fish & chips. The breading was nice and crispy. The tarter sauce was also pretty standard. My friend who got the venison burger described it as "just tasted like a normal burger." I wouldn't recommend these dishes unless you really crave them. I'm sure their other offerings are more unique and stand out more.

Their service however was stellar. There was a guy going around refilling water and he was on point in refilling my water. He probably came by at least 5-7 times. The waiter was polite and checked up on us regularly. I just wish the food that we ordered was more distinctive for a place that's in such a strategic location. But then again, I guess that's why you get things like the duck or steak that's offered here.

They have seating outside, which I think is what makes this place more worth it. Right in the middle of the city, across the bean. But spots fill up quick.

We have dined at The Gage several times and have always enjoyed it, but on our last visit they seemed to have stepped it up a notch. Or maybe we just ordered really well. In any case, it's a terrific restaurant with great service and a lively atmosphere in a fantastic location. I can never quite figure out what concept they were aiming for with the interior -- an interesting mix of casual French bistro and British gastropub -- but I like it. The menu follows suit with creative takes on traditional dishes. Everyone will be able to find something they like on the menu, from the tame to the more adventurous, and you can rest assured that it will be fresh and well-prepared. The service is usually quite good, although it can get pretty busy at peak hours. You can't beat the location, and you won't be the only one interested in dining there,  so be patient. They do a good job of accommodating as many people as possible in a reasonable amount of time without making you feel rushed through your meal. The Gage is a top notch establishment and deserves its primo position on Michigan Avenue.

I came here for lunch on one weekend afternoon around 1:30pm and it was packed, so make sure to make reservations! However, their little outdoor patio which is really nice to sit and people watch on Michigan Avenue does not take reservations. We really wanted to sit here so we had to wait an extra 20 minutes or so for a table which is fine with me. The inside has that nice, dark bistro feel to it so I definitely prefer sitting outside especially when Chicago decides to cooperate with us.

Upon sitting down, our server approached us right away and offered us some of their huge beer selection which was nice. They also do provide bread and butter if you ask, it's more of a healthy multi-grain kind if that's your type. We decided to get the Vindaloo mussels for an appetizer and it took like 10 minutes or so to get those out but once they were brought out, they were scorching hot so i knew that they were just freshly out of the pot. They were delicious, definitely get these. There is definitely enough to share and for $18 I totally think they are worth it, full of spicy flavor with some indian spices to give them that extra flare, definitely one of the best in the city I would have to say. Next stop is this much talked about venison burger which is known as one of Chicago's best burgers. I must say I thought I would be disappointed because of all the hype, but I was pleasantly surprised. For $17 get the venison over their regular burger. The meat was perfection and not too chewy or dry, had tons of flavor that it almost didn't need all their extra ingredients but I can't say I didn't enjoy the caramelized onions, the gouda cheese, jalapeños on a warm brioche bun. We shared this as well and we chose their house made chips over the fries because I am most definitely a chip girl.

Here's where we didn't go 100%. I hated the dessert. They have these new profitores (sp?) which are filled with cream and carmel and served with some chocolate ice cream. They were dry for me even though the presentation was spot on. For a $12 dessert, I was just hoping for more. I know they used to have tons of chocolate fudge desserts on the menu and I'm really sad that they took those away. So yes, bring back the fudge Gage!

Overall, it's a great place to grab a quick lunch in the area, definitely a nice bistro, but I would work on the desserts and have at least one focus on the chocolate for all those chocolate specific lovers like me.

Gastropub at its best. This place has an amazingly interesting menu and the food to back it up. We started with the Poutine which was fantastic. The Cider Braised Pork really made this dish. The Cider gave excellent bright notes. The Venison Burger was similarly delicious. Great balance of flavors. Can't wait to try the other fun items on the menu.

It's been a day, but Gage is still on my mind. The menu was interesting and I wanted pretty much everything on it. Wallet and stomach - why can't you be bigger?!?

My two friends and I went family style on the Scotch Egg (first time Scotch Egg eater and it was worth every fried and battered bite) , Caesar Salad (the real kind with anchovies - yum), Poutine (POUTINE!), Halibut, Key Lime Pie, a Mint Chocolate Cup, and some other dessert with popcorn that I don't remember the name of.

I'm actually shocked that I remembered our dinner at all because I had been liberally enjoying multiple martinis prior to going to the restaurant. This probably speaks to just how damn awesome and flavorful the meal was.

The cherry on top of our dining? Our very excellent server, Mike. Mike? Is that right? (Oh god I'm bad with names, it's me not you.) He took my table's drunkardness in stride and very good humor. Granted, he gave us all kinds of sassy hell, but it was the good kind of hurt and he had us laughing nonstop.

Go to Gage. Ask for the server maybe named Mike and eat your heart out. It's not a cheap meal and it's definitely not a healthy meal but goddamn is it a good meal.

This is a great go to place for after work drinks and dinner. I like to sit in the corner of the side room where you are somewhat isolated from the noise in the bar and the rather load back rooms.

I've liked all the appetizers and main courses I've tried on several visits, and most dishes are very shareable, so you can try a variety. The wine list is extensive, and there are some great selections by the glass, including a terrific Madeira.

Service is professional and knowledgable. And of course there's a hug and boisterous bar if you're just looking for a drink.

We went here for dinner during Restaurant Week and had a wonderful meal.  The place was crowded with many young people eating a variety of delicious looking food.  The waiter was attentive and helpful and the atmosphere was light hearted and warm.  It is not inexpensive but worth the price.

Thanks to our wonderful hotel concierge, we stumbled into this place hungry and confused. This would technically be our first real lunch in Chicago and we did not know what to expect.

Zack was attentive, knowledgeable, and best of all- funny. Who doesn't like a good laugh with their fries? After a delicious Basil Mule which made us warm and fuzzy, we ordered the fish and chips, special chicken sandwich on naan, and the lobster roll. The lobster roll and chicken sandwich were good, but man were those Fish and Chips were life changing.

Right after lunch we were able to walk right across the street to Millennium Park and the Art Institute. Thanks for being right across the street!

I suggested dinner at The Gage as I had read about its nice selection of craft beers and high caliber of food.  I knew that the prices were a bit steep, but after all, they're in a prime location.

We were only able to get a Tuesday 5 pm or 9 pm reservation a day ahead of time, so our expectation was that this would be one of our better Chicago restaurant experiences.

We were seated in the corner booth that lacked any light, the airspace over our heads occupied by a flat-panel TV that was fortunately turned off. Intimate lighting was fine by us, although our aging eyes had a hard time skimming the menu.

My first frustration came while scanning the beer menu: while there were a few good finds, it wasn't as good as the Elephant & Castle a few blocks away. Our brusque waiter really couldn't describe the rotating taps, nor did he appreciate why I might be interested in a good IPA. Drafts cost $7 or $8.

Our entrees came out promptly, with a nice chunk of Halibut ($37) accompanied by tomato-based puree that really didn't go well with this delicate fish. My date loved her dayboat scallops and salad.

We scanned the dessert menu (not that we were planning to order dessert in any case). I would have really liked to have tried their creme brulee, but $12 for dessert was more than a bit excessive.

All in all, our experience was just okay...certainly nothing that I would look to repeat and less than what I would have liked to see from a "gastropub".

A group of friends and I were visiting Chicago from Minneapolis this weekend and after a night of partying, we stumbled into the Gage, bags in tow, looking like garbage zombies. Once inside, we were met with some of THE most INCREDIBLE service I've ever had at a restaurant. Instantly, the smiling hosts got us to a table and offered to check our bags which was a welcome surprise. Our waitress, Magdeline, was not only funny and engaging, but extremely knowledgeable about the menu to the point where she knew individual spices and ingredients in the dishes and could recommend cocktails that would pair well. She was even able to tell me that a certain sauce was made with ingredients from a factory that also produced nuts (I have a severe nut allergy and have had issues at restaurants in the past). We ordered off the brunch section of the menu, and the food came out in huge portions,l with beautiful presentation, and was absolutely delicious. I ordered the B.L.T. without the bacon, and Magdeline offered to add avocado instead, which was really thoughtful and, again, absolutely delicious. By the end of our meal, we were stuffed and happy, and although she said we could sit and hang out as long as we wanted, our waitress offered us to-go cups on coffee. Right before we left, Scott, the manager, came over and chatted us up, made sure we had a great experience, and gave us his card for next time we were in Chicago. All of the small touches combined with the fantastic food and service made this a wonderful experience for all of us. I will 100% be recommending The Gage to anyone visiting the city!

We went here for a business lunch and enjoyed our lunch.  Service was a little slow, surprising since our server also had a shadow who was supposed to be doing more frequent sweeps of their tables.

Lobster Roll - fresh lobster and really liked the fried onions on top, gave it a nice crunch
Poutine - really good starter app but cheese was melted inconsistently
Salmon BLT - was told it was good but they probably wouldn't order again
WONDERFUL dining experience. Amazing food choices, everything was fresh, perfectly seasoned & awesome presentation. Restaurant itself is beautifully decorated, perfect location.  LOVED dining here!

Here is another super late night stop in for our Chicago Travels.  and it was fabulous!!!
I can not wait to come back so I can enjoy as standard dinner service.  
Drinks were great.  Dessert was wonderful.  Our service was perfect and friendly.
Food was the worst I've ever had in Chicago.  Service was poor too.  The food was really bad!  Neither of us ate our salads or meals.  The server didn't notice.  Overpriced wine.

Had great service and amazing food! We got the game of the day (delicious grass fed bison) and the rainbow trout.  Both were exceptional choices.  Would definitely recommend for a nice dinner and drinks nearby the art institute!
Love dining here have always wanted to use their private dining room!

My friends and I had a nice time here. The gage has a nice decor though it can be a little loud inside. For the most part it was fine but sometimes I had a hard time hearing people. The service was attentive but not overbearing which is good.

I loved! My carrot ravioli. It was super yummy but I would have liked the portion to be slightly bigger. Though for the price it was reasonable. My friends enjoyed their meals and everything looked really good when it came out. No one had a complaint there. The desserts were good too. I was happy with basic ice cream.

So many things sounded interesting I might go back. But this place isn't cheap. You know that going in but it's a little pretentious in my opinion.

Before making a brunch reservation here, I read through several dozen negative reviews. Now that I'm on the other side, I can say that most of the criticisms of The Gage are laughable.

High prices and small portions were what we expected. Fine, I thought. Some trendy place with over-the-top presentation and pretentious service. I can deal with it. I was willing to take the risk. (Hopefully my girlfriend will like it?)

Instead, we were blown away. We split the seasonal yogurt and fruit (~$14). Huge cup of yogurt, granola, and more fruit than we could handle. It was more filling than you'd expect yogurt and fruit to be. Next, I ordered Chilaquiles ($13) while my dining partner ordered smoked salmon ($15). We were told that the smoked salmon would be a "light" portion (which is why I didn't order it), it ended up being a huge serving. She struggled to pile all of the smoked salmon onto the bagel, and that was after I helped myself to some of it. The Chilaquiles was, again, a massive portion. Never have I been so satisfied by a breakfast item featuring "two eggs".

Our server was exactly what you'd hope for when you get brunch: helpful but subdued. Not in your face, not checking up on you every five minutes, but was happy to make recommendations beyond "I like everything!". I look forward to returning for lunch or dinner.

The location is excellent but the food and prices...? Not so much. Our food came out staggered, which you wouldn't expect if you were paying 60 dollars per plate. There were also flies around, which I guess is somewhat expected given how many people were coming in and out of the door.

Just wish it was better.

This is my go-to place if someone asks me "Where's a good spot to eat in the loop (downtown)?"

Menus change seasonally.  Great cocktails and after work bar scene if you're just looking for drinks.  Incredibly attentive service if you're dining.  Just an overall great experience, always.  It can get busy so definitely make a reservation if you're planning on going during a peak time.

Venison burger is phenomenal. So is the Scotch Egg.  Fish and chips are pretty amazing too, as are the mussels.  They usually have some great specials also, so make sure you ask your server what's up.

I don't write reviews often, but The Gage is totally worth it.

This place is hands down one of the best restaurants I've been to. We had the pleasure of dining here 2 years ago when we were in the area and decided to go again while we were in town for Lollapalooza. We dined here for an early dinner on Thursday and brunch on Saturday. Very accommodating as I have to be gluten free and dairy free, the servers and staff are always pleasant, and the food is wonderful! This isn't the place to go if you're on a budget. If you're willing to splurge, though, I don't think you'll be disappointed!

The drink menu is unique with a ton of selection. They even had special drinks they did just for Lollapalooza and were very welcoming even though we weren't dressed up. I would say the atmosphere is a bit on the classier side, so shorts and sneakers didn't really 'fit in' but we were not treated one bit different for it. The food menu had a number of options for everyone in our group, including me. Our server both times (for an early dinner and brunch, different servers) were more than happy to go over menu options that were safe for me and even checked with the chef to make sure that what I was ordering was, in fact, gluten free. They even included a note to the kitchen without me having to ask for it. Definitely a great place if you have any kind of food allergies or issues because they are incredibly accommodating. This alone is worth 5 stars for me personally, but the food!! Oh man, even if I didn't have to be gluten and dairy free, I would be coming here for the food. House made sausages (YUM!), curry gravy for dipping fries in, lobster roll... all in all, really good menu that you can tell they put time, effort, and love into.

The only thing that detracted for me was that early dinner Thursday, the patio overhang was leaking pretty badly when it was raining out and left both of my dining companions a bit wet due to the splashing as water came through the (poorly constructed) patio roof. This wasn't really a big deal given we'd been at Lollapalooza part of the morning, but it did detract from the experience. They did offer to move us to another outdoor table, however those were getting wet as well and the indoor tables were full with a wait. Still, the food and service were great despite the leaky patio roof. It's definitely on my list of places to go when I'm in Chicago and a place I'd recommend to others.

pics.caption: Dinner menu. Very accommodating for gluten free here!

review.des: We went to The Gage before our visit to the Art Institute and I was pleasantly surprised. Our visit happened to coincide with restaurant week, so we enjoyed a three course meal from a fixed menu. It was an extraordinary deal for delicious gourmet food. I didn't have any alcohol so I can't speak to that. But the food was great, the ambiance was nice, and the service was first rate... The waiter kept my coffee fresh throughout the entire meal and when we wanted to switch tables because ours was a tad wobbly, there was no hassle at all.
